In this way, Juan will improve the condition of his house and be able to provide greater security and well-being to his family, whom he loves very much and wants to be able to help.

loans.use: to make improvements to his residence.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru:
Саиде 42 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Саида в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи,  с 2010 года занимается предоставлением услуг компьютерного зала. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 50,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Саида смогла увеличить количество компьютеров, а также включила членов семьи в этот бизнес. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 20,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Саида обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку компьютеров.  Доходы от кредита Саида планирует вложить в оплату обучения для своего сына, который в этом году будет поступать в ВУЗ.
texts.en:
Saida is 42 years old, married and bringing up for three children. As a main source of income for her family, since 2010 she has been running an Internet café. Having launched this business with 50,000 KGS, Saida, thanks to her hard work and resilience, has been able to increase the number of PCs and also got her family members involved in the business. Her monthly revenues are about 20,000 KGS.

In order to develop her business further, Saida turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 135,000 KGSintended  for buying computers. Saida plans to use the resulting income for paying the tuition fees of her son, who is applying to college this year.

loans.use: to purchase computers.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita comes from Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Florita is widowed and has two children. To make a living, Florita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, sugar, candies, and toothpaste in the local community. Florita been in business for 8 years and earns 8,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Florita joined GDMPC. Florita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 44 años, vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Mala; él es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia; con mucho empeño culmino sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte con sus hijos y en el algunas ocasiones le gusta engreír a su familia cocinando una riquísima Carapulcra.
Con mucho entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace varios años Miguel trabaja como chofer de carga pesada, él cuenta con una buena experiencia en este rubro, gracias a ello y a su buena atención ha podido conservar y ganar cada día más clientes, él labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor.
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción, mantenimiento de su vehículo y la compra de repuestos para este; de esta manera Miguel tendrá su vehículo en buenas condiciones, mejor acondicionado y podrá durar unos años más, con ello él espera poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizar para poder asegurar la educación y bienestar de sus queridos hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 44 year old man. He lives with his wife and their two children in the city of Cañete, in the district of Mala. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. He puts all of his efforts into helping his family get ahead. With much persistence, he completed secondary school. Sadly, he was not able to continue with a professional degree, but if he were able to, he would have liked to study mechanical engineering. In his free time he likes to play sports with his kids and on special occasions likes to spoil his family by cooking Carapulcra (a spicy Peruvian stew made with dehydrated potatoes, pork and chicken in a spicy peanut sauce) for them.  

With much enthusiasm, and thanks to the support of his family, a few years ago Miguel started working as a truck driver, transporting heavy loads. He has had good experience in this work, thanks to this and the good service he provides he has been able to keep current customers and as well as gain more customers everyday. He works approximately 10 hours a day and he enjoys doing his work. 

Miguel is very thankful for Kiva lenders; thanks to the support provided he will be able to perform repairs and maintenance on his vehicle and buy spare parts. This will allow him to have his vehicle in good condition and well kept and will help it to last many more years. With this he hopes to increase his income, which he wants to use to ensure the education and well-being of his beloved children.

loans.use: to perform repairs and maintenance and buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Mignonmide 1 Group

texts.fr: MIGNONMIDE 1 est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres exercent les mêmes activités et s’approvisionnent au même lieu. La présidente du groupe, Ablavi (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Marcellin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Ablavi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la famille. Il y a près de quinze ans que Ablavi vend de l’huile de palme et du vin de palme à son domicile. C'est cette activité que Ablavi exerce et qui lui permet de contribuer aux besoins de sa famille. Ablavi achète ses produits dans sa région. C’est la sixième fois que Ablavi et les autres membres du groupe MIGNONMIDE 1 sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Les cinq premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mignonmide 1 is a group of four people, who all have the same kind of business and get their supplies in the same place. The group’s president is called Ablavi (pictured with her fingers raised in the photo). She is 44 years of age, and is married to a farmer called Marcellin. The couple has four children, all under their care and all at school. 

Ablavi lives together with her husband and children. Together the couple makes sure that the family’s various needs are met. For almost 15 years Ablavi has sold palm oil and palm wine from her home, and this business allows her to contribute to the needs of her family. She buys her products in the region where she lives. 

This is the sixth time that Ablavi and the other members of the Mignonmide 1 group have requested a loan from Alidé. This loan will allow them to boost their businesses and better meet the demands of their customers. The group’s first five loans have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy palm wine and pine nuts.

loans.name: Minmonsso Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MINMONSSO est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui s’approvisionnent au même endroit. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mèdédjigbé Pauline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mèdédjigbé Pauline est âgée de 58 ans et est une veuve. Mèdédjigbé Pauline est mère de quatre enfants dont aucun scolarisé et aucun n'est plus à sa charge. Mèdédjigbé Pauline vit seule et assure seule ses différentes besoins. Depuis près de sept ans, Mèdédjigbé Pauline vend des produits de mercerie à son domicile, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. C’est dans une ville du Bénin et au Nigéria que Mèdédjigbé Pauline s’approvisionne. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Mèdédjigbé Pauline sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe  MINMONSSO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Minmonsso group has three female members, who are all friends and get their supplies in the same place. The group’s representative is called Mèdédjigbé Pauline, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 58 years of age and a widow. She has four children, none of whom are at school. None of her children remain under her care. 

Mèdédjigbé Pauline lives alone, and is solely responsible for her various needs. For almost seven years she has sold sewing products at home, a business which allows her to provide for herself without any great difficulty. She gets her supplies from a town in Benin, and also in Nigeria. In order to ensure that her customers are satisfied and to increase her income, Mèdédjigbé Pauline has requested her first loan from Alidé along with the members of the Minmonsso group.

loans.use: To buy sewing products.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has been earning a living through proving transportation services for five years so as to support the needs of her two children. She gets an income of 5,000 PHP a month for this business.

 For a 31-year-old mother, there’s nothing that can make her happier than to see her children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Marife is borrowing the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair her transport vehicle used in her business and provide her children a better education. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is married and has one child. Susanita is 52 years old, and resides at Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Susanita owns and operate a farmland, planting & harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living and she's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

In 2007, Susanita joined GDMPC. Susanita requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to pay for labor costs in farm maintenance.  In the future, Susanita wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in farm maintenance

loans.name: Cela

texts.en:
Cela is from Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old, married and has two children. To make a living, Cela manages a gardening business and been two years in this work. She usually gets 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.

 In 2011, Cela joined Kiva partner, GDMPC. Cela is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre “El Progreso” están en el Quinto Ciclo  con   17  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas. Además hacen actividades juntas para poder ayudarse y de esa forma poder salir adelante.
Mariela es miembro de este grupo, y comenta que con mucho gusto siempre se reúne con sus compañeras de grupo. Es gracias al programa y a su esfuerzo que esta pudiendo salir adelante.  Mariela vende todo tipo de comestibles y de esa forma ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de condimentos, verduras, carnes, hortalizas y demás insumos para poder seguir vendiendo los alimentos que hace.
texts.en:
The communal bank bears the name, "El Progreso,” and has 17 members who are in their fifth loan cycle. It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very close-knit, responsible and supportive of one another. In addition they do activities together, so that they can help each other, and that way be able to move forward.

Mariela is a member of this group, and says that it is always a great pleasure for her to meet with her fellow group members. It is thanks to the program and to her effort, that she is succeeding. Mariela sells all kinds of foodstuffs and that way helps her family and gives them what they need for a decent life.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy condiments, greens, meats, vegetables, and the rest of the ingredients she needs to be able to continue selling the food she prepares.

loans.use: To buy condiments, greens, meats, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ma. Jonep

texts.en:
Ma. Jonep is a 35-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in agricultural business, specifically rice farming, in their lot together with her husband. When not farming, her husband works as a carpenter. 

At this time, Ma. Jonep is in need of additional capital for her business. She is requesting a loan worth 4000 PHP to buy seedlings to plant, fertilizers and pest control. With this, she will be able to grow a healthy crop thus giving her the opportunity to increase her income.

Ma. Jonep works hard to assist her husband in meeting the needs of their family, especially for their two young children. In the future, Ma. Jonep hopes to expand their farm to increase the quantity of their crop yield. Moreover, she wants to continually send their children to school for better education and learning.

loans.use: to buy seedlings to plant, fertilizers and pest control

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 40 years old, married and has three children ages 8, 9, and 11. She is from Cortes, Bohol. Zenaida operates a small restaurant, locally known as "carenderia" in the neighborhood. This business started 10 years ago. Her husband serves as her chief cook in the business. 

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy kitchen utensils, soft drinks and spices. With the additional capital, she will be able to expand her menu, make her place more attractive to her customers, and serve them better. The income that she will generate will help her pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, soft drinks and spices

loans.name: San  Roque Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ROQUE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco. 

El socio David tiene 20 años y es soltero; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja durante el día por horas ya que a la vez el socio se está preparando para postular a la universidad a la carrera profesional de economía, él socio es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar estudiando y trabajando para su futuro.

El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar sus estudios de la academia pre universitaria.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, elaboración de chicha, compra y venta de artesania, restaurante, crianza de animales menores, ganadería, venta de maíz,docencia.

El socio que sale adjunto en la foto pidio permiso para no asistir a la reunion por motivos de trabajo, tomandole despues la foto.

El  socio agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
David belongs to the “San Roque” communal bank located in Andahuaylillas District belonging to Quispicanchis Province and Cusco Department.  He’s 20-year-old and single.

He alternates his daily activities with providing taxi services.  He works for a few hours during the day since he’s also preparing to enter the university to study Economics.  He’s a cheerful, responsible person who very much wants to continue with his studies and working for his future.  He’s requesting a loan to pay for his college-prep course.

The other group members have a grocery store, make chicha [corn-based drink], buy and sell crafts, have a restaurant, raise small farm animals, raise cattle, sell corn and teach.

The member in the inserted photo requested permission to miss the meeting because of his work so his photo was taken later.

David is grateful for the loan he’s being granted and commits to make his payments.

loans.use: to pay for his college-prep course.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
Perfil Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción 
Fray Casiano Puntarenas
Julio 2012

	Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción está formado por  5 integrantes quienes han trabajado en años anteriores tanto con Fundación Mujer como en otros grupos de la zona de Puntarenas, demostrando organización, solidaridad, trabajo en grupo, además de mantener un ahorro y una organización consolidada. 

Las solicitantes del préstamo grupal  tienen 5 años de trabajar  en la zona. Con el Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción se realizaron 2 reuniones; primero   capacitando e instruyendo a las demás en la modalidad del crédito grupal de Banco Mujer y segundo formalizar las solicitudes de crédito. Para lo cual se conformó  la Junta Directiva y se levantó el acta  de formación de este grupo.

	Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción presenta actividades diversas y consolidadas permitiendo tener una base importante para garantizar este préstamo. Las integrantes tienen claro cómo llevar la generación de ingresos de cada una, tienen los conceptos de trabajo en grupo, garantía solidaria y ahorro.  Su trabajo y esfuerzo está validado con el apoyo de instituciones como el Instituto Mixto de Ayuda Social y Fundación Mujer, quien les ha permitido tener actividades consolidadas (pulpería, bazar y café Internet),  contando con equipo, local y mobiliario para su microempresa. Esté crédito les va a permitir invertir para medio año y el día de la madre, incrementar  su inventario de mercadería y arreglo de algunos  equipos, en el caso del café internet.

	
	Ellas son mujeres empoderadas, luchadoras y muy trabajadoras, el trabajo en grupo las ha hecho fuertes y la organización en sí,  una buena estrategia para mantenerse en pie en estos 5 años. Su solidaridad y empeño para con los y las demás personas las destaca en su comunidad como mujeres que saben prestar un buen servicio  al Barrio Fray Casiano,  lugar al cual pertenecen en la provincia de Puntarenas. 


	Han participado como líderes en el Barrio Fray Casiano de Puntarenas un lugar con altos índices de pobreza y problemas sociales como drogas y delincuencia. Estas mujeres tratan de apoyar a otras más jóvenes como Giannina y Karol a buscar en el trabajo y esfuerzo, ganar el dinero para mantener sus hogares y a sus familias.
texts.en:
Profile: Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción 
Fray Casiano Puntarenas
July 2012

Communal bank Mujer Mujeres en Acción has 5 members who have previously worked with Fundación Mujer and other institutions in the Puntarenas area, showing strong administration skills, solidarity, and teamwork, while also saving and running a tight organization. The applicants have been working in the area for 5 years. As communal bank Mujer Mujeres en Acción, they have met twice: first, to train and instruct the others in the Banco Mujer group's structure; and second, to draw up the loan application on which the board is named and the group is recognized. 	

Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción has diverse and joint businesses, allowing it a strong base on which to guarantee this loan. The members know how to generate income from each activity and understand the concepts of teamwork, joint responsibility, and saving. Their work and effort is supported by institutions such as Instituto Mixto de Ayuda Social and Fundación Mujer, which has allowed them to manage joint businesses (a grocery store, bazaar, and Internet cafe) and maintain staff, locations, and equipment for their micro business. This loan will be used to invest in seasonal and Mother's day merchandise and repair some equipment in the Internet cafe.
	
These women are empowered, dedicated, and very hardworking. Teamwork has made the organization itself strong and been an excellent strategy to keep the business going over the past 5 years. Their solidarity and collaboration with one another and others makes them stand out in their community as women who know how to provide great service to Barrio Fray Casiano, the area in Puntarenas province where they live. They have been leaders in Barrio Fray Casiano in Puntarenas, an area plagued by poverty and social problems such as drugs and crime. These women try to support the younger women like Giannina y Karol in finding work and earning the money to support their households and families.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise (Mother's Day) for a stationary store, an internet café, and catalog sales

loans.name: Fatiauma

texts.en: Fatiauma is a 36 year old married woman with seven children. She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Fatiauma has requested a loan to help her purchase equipment and materials for her vegetable garden use. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Fatiauma will spend her profits to help her improve and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy farming tools such as rakes, forks, bushknives, chemicals, fertilizers, vegetable seeds and gloves.

loans.name: Taranina

texts.en:
Taranina is a 25 year old married woman with four children. She would like to start growing taros and bananas at her plantation to earn a living. Taranina has requested a loan to help her start her business. 
She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Taranina will spend her profits to improve her plantation for further needs.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment and tools such as bush knives, a planting spear, rakes, fertilizers, chemicals, and taro roots.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a 24 year old, married woman with four children. She would like to start growing crops like taro, yams, and bananas to earn a living. Doreen has requested a loan to help her purchase tools and equipment to start her plantation. 
She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Doreen will spend her profits to increase and improve her plantation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment and tools such as fertilizers, chemicals, weed killer, bush knives, and rakes.

loans.name: Tiresa

texts.en:
Tiresa is a 46 year old, married woman with five children. She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Tiresa has requested a loan to purchase vegetable seeds and also wanted materials to help her start her vegetable garden. 
She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Tiresa will spend her profits to increase the quality of her garden.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials for a vegetable garden such as gloves, planting tools, rakes, fertilizers, and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación se encuentran en el ciclo numero 20. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y apoyo trabajo están saliendo adelante y se ayudan siempre las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Laura ella  tiene una despensa bastante surtida en su casa, donde tiene una clientela bien formada gracias a que es una persona con muy buena onda para las ventas. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma ser una gran microempresaria.
Cuenta la Sra. Laura que pide el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, carnes, y demás productos, ya que son los que mas salida tienen. Agradecen todas ellas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnación and is in its cycle #20.  Thanks to their hard work and mutual support they are getting ahead and they help each other out always.

One of the members of the group is Laura.  She has a very well-stocked store at home where she has a well-established clientele thanks to her being a person who is very adept at selling.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing to become a great micro businesswoman this way.

Laura relates that she’s asking for the loan to buy soft-drinks, dairy products, meats and other products which are the ones that sell the most.  All of the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: tgo buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
a señora Maria tiene 41 años de edad, está casada con el señor Isabelin, tienen 2 hijos, viven en el centro de la ciudad de Itá.
La señora Maria tiene una boutique hace mas de 10 años en un lugar estratégicamente ubicado de la ciudad de Itá, allí vende al contado y a créditos diversas variedades de prendas de vestir, tales como camisas, remeras, pantalones, mocasines, sandalias, cintos. Gracias a su sacrificio está saliendo adelante y también está ayudando a su marido con los gastos del día a día.
Solicita el préstamo para aumentar su stock de prendas ya que a partir de mitad de año siempre aumentan las ventas y desea estar preparada de la mejor manera y brindarles a sus clientes calidad y variedad con sus prendas nacionales e importadas.
texts.en:
María, 41, is married to Isabelin.  They have two children and they live in downtown Itá.  María has had a boutique for more than 10 years in a strategically located spot in the city of Itá.  She sells assorted articles of clothing like shirts, t-shirts, pants, moccasins, sandals and belts for cash and on credit.  Thanks to her sacrifice she’s getting ahead and also helping her husband with everyday expenses.

She’s asking for the loan to increase her stock of clothing because sales always increase starting mid-year and she wants to be prepared in the best way possible to provide her customers with quality and variety of national and imported clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Latacunga,  capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, es una hermosa ciudad situada en las faldas del volcán dormido Cotopaxi que muestra majestuosamente su manto de nieve.  A pesar de estar muy cerca del nevado, Latacunga tiene una temperatura promedio de 12°C y un clima templado-frío. Es una de las ciudades más importantes de la sierra ecuatoriana gracias al desarrollo sostenido que se dio a partir de los inicios del siglo XXI.  Actualmente Latacunga cuenta con alrededor de 63.842 habitantes. El clima y condiciones no sólo geográficas sino también atmosféricas han permitido que el negocio florícola de la zona crezca y se convierta en el motor económico y un importante generador de divisas de la Sierra Centro del Ecuador.

La minería es otra actividad que sostiene a Latacunga, la extracción de caliza y cemento además del crecimiento de la industria metalúrgica liviana y pesada, la agroindustria, la muy conocida industria lechera y ganadera han hecho de esta ciudad una de las muchas ciudades ecuatorianas que promete avances extraordinarios. En la actualidad cuenta con su propio aeropuerto internacional y un crecimiento urbano impresionante que cuenta con grandes mercados y centros comerciales.

Es en esta hermosa ciudad, encontramos a Luis un emprendedor de 37 años que aprovecha el crecimiento de Latacunga para fortalecer su negocio. Hace 5 años, Luis decidió abrir su taller mecánico teniendo en cuenta que Latacunga es una ciudad muy transitada no sólo por vehículos livianos sino también camiones, volquetas y camiones de carga que generan bastante clientela. Cada día Luis trabaja casi 10 horas en su taller y vuelve a casa para pasar tiempo en familia con sus tres hijos y su esposa María de 25 años. Él piensa que el servicio al cliente y la realización de un trabajo eficiente y eficaz es la clave de un buen negocio y espera que su negocio se fortalezca con estos valores.  Por lo tanto, él acude a Fundación Alternativa, institución que a través que Kiva puede financiar a distintas personas emprendedoras. Con el crédito solicitado, Luis espera poder comprar maquinaria nueva para realizar más rápido su trabajo y de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos y poder mejorar de igual manera la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Latacunga, capital of Cotopaxi Province, is a beautiful city located at the foot of the dormant Cotopaxi Volcano draped with its majestic cover of snow.  Despite being very close to the snow-covered mountain, Latacunga’s average temperature is 12°C and has a moderately cold climate.  It is one of the most important cities in the Ecuadorian mountains thanks to the sustained development it’s had since the beginning of the 21st Century.  At present, Latacunga has approximately 63,842 inhabitants.  Its climate as well as its geographic and atmospheric conditions has allowed flower growing to flourish and to become the economic motor and an important generator of income for the Ecuadorian Central Mountains

Mining is another activity that supports Latacunga.  Limestone and cement extraction, the growth of heavy and light metallurgy industry, agribusiness and the very well-known dairy and cattle industries have made this city into one of the cities in Ecuador that promises extraordinary advances.  It has its own international airport and impressive urban development with large markets and centers of commerce.

In this beautiful city lives Luis, a 37-year-old entrepreneur who has taken advantage of Latacunga’s growth to strengthen his business.  Five years ago 
Luis decided to open a vehicle repair shop noting that Latacunga is a city with much traffic not just of light vehicles but also trucks, dump-trucks and cargo hauling trucks which generate quite a large clientele.

Luis works almost ten hours daily every day in his shop and returns time to spend family time with his three children and his wife, María, 25.  He believes that customer service and efficient, effective work is the key to a good business and he hopes his business will be stronger thanks to these values.

Therefore, he’s calling on Fundación Alternativa, an institution through which Kiva can finance various enterprising people.  With the requested loan, Luis will be able to buy new machinery to do his jobs more quickly thus meeting customer needs and improving his income to also be able in the same way to improve the quality of life of his entire family.

loans.use: to upgrade machinery.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de manualidades como muñecas,carteras entre otros,la socia tambien se sigue dedicanod al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como perumes,cremas y lapiz labiales,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salira adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar meteriales para sus manualidades como tela,lanas y pinturas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rina has continued in her business of making crafts such as dolls, wallets and other items.  She also continues to sell beauty products such as perfumes, creams and lipstick.  Her goal is to make economic progress through these business activities.  She is seeking this loan in order to purchase materials for her crafts, such as thread, wool and paints.  

She is grateful for this loan opportunity and promises to repay her loan on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her crafts, such as thread, wool and paints.

loans.name: Siroj

texts.ru:
Сироч родился 1950 году в районе А. Джоми. Он живет вместе с женой. У них пятеро детей. Сыновья Сироча находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. 
Сам Сироч имеет среднее образование. 
Он занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Сироч более 26 лет занимается этим видом деятельности.
Он берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого и крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Siroj was born in 1950 in the region of A. Jomi. He lives together with his wife and they have five children. Siroj's sons are now working in the Russian Federation. Siroj has secondary education. He breeds large horned cattle. Siroj has been in this business for more than 26 years. He is taking out the loan to buy small horned and large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy calves, sheep and goats.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Нигина проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 22 года. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. 
Нигина имеет средне - специальное образование. Она работает портнихой в ателье. Нигина в основном занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. 
Нигина берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки. Она хочет продолжит свою деятельность у себя дома. 
Кроме того Нигина намерена провести ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Nigina lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 22 years old and not married. She lives together with parents. Nigina has specialized secondary education. She works as a seamstress in a shop. Nigina mainly sews traditional Tajik dresses. She has been in this business for five years. She is taking out the loan to buy a sewing machine. Nigina wants to continue to do her business at home. She also plans to do some remodeling in her home.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to remodel the house.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expected a boost in her income as she expanded her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, house hold, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mary Grace dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members where she shares stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juan Genaro

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad caracterizada por su clima cálido y gente acogedora; Juan es una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cuando visitar a sus padres cocina una riquísima Carapulcra para compartir con su familia.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Juan se encuentra estudiando su carrera profesional de Ingeniero Forestal; Juan labora como empleado en una empresa maderera de su ciudad, él trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el tarrajeado y pintado de la fachada de su local de ventas de bebidas, tales como refrescos, gaseosas, agua embotellada, licores, entre otras; de esta manera Juan tendrá su negocio en mejores condiciones y más presentable ante sus clientes, con ello él espera poder atraer mayor cantidad de clientes y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizar para poder culminar su carrera profesional y así en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder cumplir su gran sueño de tener su propia empresa de venta de madera.
texts.en:
Juan, 28, lives in the city of Pucallpa, characterized by its warm climate and welcoming people.  Juan is a very happy, enthusiastic, and hardworking person who very much wants to improve himself.  In his free time he likes to read and sometimes, when his parents visit, he cooks a delicious "carapulcra" [meat and potato stew] to share with his family.

Thanks to his effort and the support of his family, Juan is studying to be a forestry engineer.  Juan is an employee of a lumber business in his city.  He works approximately 10 hours a day and feels comfortable doing his job because they appreciate him for his performance and his friendliness with people.

Juan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to plaster and paint the front of his beverage store, where he sells soft drinks, soda, bottled water, liquor, and other beverages.  This way Juan's business will be in better shape and more presentable to his customers.  With this he hopes to be able to attract more customers and so increase his income, which he wants to use to finish his education.

In the near future he hopes to be able to realize his big dream, to have his own business selling wood.

loans.use: to plaster and paint the front of his beverage store.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El Señor Guido tiene 37 años, está acompañado con la Señora Idalina de 38 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, ellos viven en la Ciudad de Itá.
El señor Guido se dedica a la Oleria (fabricación y venta de ladrillos), además a la faena de animales vacunos, esta actividad lo realiza 2 veces por semana, dándoles un buen promedio de ganancias y gracias a si esfuerzo ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de arcilla, el cual es el principal insumo que necesita para la fabricación de sus ladrillos.
texts.en: Guido, 37, lives with Idalina, 38, with whom he has 3 children; they live in the city of Itá.  Guido works manufacturing bricks and also slaughters cattle twice a week producing good average profits; thanks to his efforts he already has a good clientele formed.  He’s asking for the loan to buy clay which is the main raw material needed to manufacture bricks.

loans.use: to buy clay to make bricks.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назире  39 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей -  школьников. 
 В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, с января 2012 года Назира  начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания и мыломоющими  товарами, взяв в аренду контейнер недалеко от дома. Начав   этот бизнес со стартовой  суммы в 50,000 сом (KGS),  благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Назира сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  10,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назира обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) для покупки витринного холодильника.  Доходы от кредита Назира хотела бы вложить в выкуп арендованного контейнера.
texts.en:
Nazira is 39 years old, she is married and has two children who are school age. Seeking a source of income for her family Nazira has started a business since January of 2012 selling food and cleaning products by renting out a container not far from her home. She began the business with a starting capital of 50,000 som (KGS) and because of her persistence and hard work Nazira was able to grow her business with a monthly income of 100,000 som.

With a goal to further grow her business Nazira has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 25,000 som to buy a display refrigerator. She plans to invest the income from the loan to buy out the rented container.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Evelith

texts.es:
Evelith tiene 27 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser amable y cordial. Está separada del padre de sus dos  hijos.  Vive en compañía de su padre, su madre, sus tres hermanos, su abuelo, su tío y sus hijos de 8 y 5 años, a los que quiere mucho.

Su actividad es la venta de gaseosas de diversas marcas y sabores. Para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora y un pequeño local en su casa donde atiende a sus clientes. Inició hace más de 3  años con un capital propio y actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, quienes atienden cuando ella está fuera de casa. Paralelo a esta actividad, también se dedica a la preparación de mermeladas, oficio que aprendió en un proyecto de la municipalidad de su localidad, pero por el momento no lo está realizando. Le gusta su trabajo porque le permite estar ocupada y tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Escogió este negocio ya que vio poca competencia por la zona, lo que ahora le da tranquilidad emocional y financiera. Por otro lado, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene planes de mejorar e implementar su negocio y comprarse otra refrigeradora. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente contenta por contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Además, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, ya que conoce a sus miembros y los considera personas amables y responsables.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá 700 en la compra de más gaseosas, con el saldo hará reparar su actual refrigeradora que está fallando.
texts.en:
Evelith, age 27, is a hard-working woman with a great desire to succeed and to be kind and friendly. She is separated from the father of her children and lives with her father, mother, three siblings, grandfather, uncle, and children ages 8 and 5. She loves them very much.
She sells pop of various brands and flavours. For this business, she has a fridge and a small store in her home where she serves her customers. She started her business three years ago with a small capital. Now, her parents help her out and watch the store when she is away. On top of this business, she also makes jam. She learned to do this from a project in her municipality. However, at the moment she is not making jam. She enjoys her work because it allows her to be occupied and have an income with which to offer a better quality of life to her family. She chose this business because she saw that there was little competition in the area. This means that she now has emotional and financial security. On the other hand, seeing the good results of her business, she plans to improve and stock her business by buying another fridge.

This is her second loan with MFP. She is happy to have a line of credit to move her business forward. Furthermore, she says that she is comfortable with her communal bank, since she knows the members and considers them to be friendly and responsible people.

With the requested amount, 1000 nuevos soles, she will invest 700 in the purchase of more pop. With the rest she will repair her fridge, which is failing.

loans.use: to buy more pop and repair her fridge.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Komlan est un homme de 36ans. Il est marié à une coiffeuse et ont ensemble 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Ils sont âgés de 09 et 02ans. 01 personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité (vente de jus et pure water (eau minérale mise en sachet)). Il le fait à domicile et la difficulté qu’il rencontre est le ralentissement de l’activité en période de pluies. Il sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter un congélateur. Avec les profits réalisés, il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, ouvrir une boutique de vente d’arôme jumelé à la vente de jus et aider sa famille à mieux vivre.
texts.en:
Komlan is 36 years old. He is married to a hairdresser and together they have 2 children, one of whom goes to school. The children are aged nine and two. 

Komlan is assisted by 1 person in his business (selling juice and pure water - mineral water in bags). He works from home and the challenge he is facing is slower activity in the rainy season. 

He is requesting a second loan to buy a freezer. With the profit, he wants to reinvest in the business, open a shop to sell perfume as as selling juice, and to help his family achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Grecia

texts.es:
Grecia tiene 20 años, es una joven trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser alegre y muy amable. Es soltera, no tiene hijos. Vive en compañía de su madre, sus tres hermanos y su abuela, en casa de su madre.
Su actividad es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, ya que le llamó la atención, porque su madre también se dedica a ese oficio. Luego compró su primera máquina de coser para empezar y con las ganancias logró comprar otras máquinas. Realiza esta actividad en la casa de su madre en un ambiente especial para ellas, trabajan en sociedad. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener una ocupación y generar un ingreso para ahorrar y apoyar a su familia. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y comprar más máquinas y abrir una tienda de venta de ropa donde pueda exhibir sus trabajos.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP. Por tanto cuenta con este préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Y le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, invertirá en la  compra de telas, botones, cierres, elástico y demás accesorios para la costura. Todos traídos desde la capital (Lima), buscando precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras.
texts.en:
Grecia, age 20, is a hard-working young woman with a great desire to succeed.  She is also cheerful and very kind.  She is single, and she does not have children.  She lives with her mother, her three siblings, and her grandmother in her mother’s house.

She is a seamstress, an occupation she learned by attending an occupational education center.  It caught her attention because he mother is also a seamstress.  She then bought her first sewing machine in order to start.  With her income she managed to buy other machines.  She does this business activity in her mother’s house in a special area for them; they work together.

She likes what she does.  It allows her to have an occupation and to generate an income in order to save and to support her family.  She has plans to expand her business, to buy more machines, and to open a store selling clothes where she is able to display her work.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She counts on this loan to be able to meet her objectives.  She pledges to make her payments.  She is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

She will use the requested 1,200 soles to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, elastic, and other sewing accessories.  She will get everything in the capital (Lima) as she is looking for low prices for buying in volume.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials in the country's capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sang De Jesus 1 Group

texts.fr: SANG DE JESUS 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Fifadji Judith (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31 ans. Fifadji Judith a peu fréquenté l'école. Fifadji Judith est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Samson. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a près de trois ans que Fifadji Judith vend des produits de mercerie à son domicile. Fifadji Judith s'approvisionne au Nigeria et dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Fifadji Judith sollicite un crédit ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SANG DE JESUS 1, crédit qui leur permettra surement à hausser le niveau de leurs activités et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
SANG DE JESUS 1 is a group of three people. The members are friends and belong to the same savings group. 

The group's leader, Fifadji Judith (hand raised in the photo) is 31 years old. She didn't attend school for very long. She is married to a driver named Samson. They have four children some of whom have been to school and who are all in their care. The children live with their parents. Together, Fifadji Judith and her husband meet the household expenses.

For almost three years, Fifadji Judith has been selling haberdashery items from home. She obtains her supplies in Nigeria and in a town in Benin. 

This is the first time that Fifadji Judith has asked for a loan together with the other members of the SANG DE JESUS 1 group. The loan will allow them to increase their level of activity and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery items.

loans.name: Ogo-Oluwa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OGO-OLUWA est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et habitent toutes dans le même quartier à au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Élisabeth Djidonou, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo.  Âgée de 43 ans, Élisabeth Djidonou est mariée à un matelassier du nom de Barthélémy. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et deux restent à leur charge. Élisabeth Djidonou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de cinq ans que Élisabeth Djidonou mène comme activité, la vente de tissus et des chaussures de façon ambulante. Élisabeth Djidonou s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et à Lomé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Élisabeth Djidonou désire obtenir un troisième financement, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The OGO-OLUWA group is made up of three women who are friends and who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's leader, Élisabeth Djidonou, has her hand raised in the photo. Élisabeth is 43 years old and is married to a mattress maker called Barthélémy. They have four children, some of whom have been to school. Two children are still in their care. Élisabeth Djidonou lives together with her husband and children. Together, the couple meet the household's expenses.

For almost five years, Élisabeth  has been selling fabric and shoes, on foot. She obtains her supplies from a town in Benin and in Lomé. With the goal of increasing her activity and better meeting customer demand, Élisabeth Djidonou wants to obtain a third loan, together with the other members of the group.  The first two loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and shoes.

loans.name: Cecilia Matilde

texts.es:
Latacunga,  capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, es una hermosa ciudad situada en las faldas del volcán dormido Cotopaxi que muestra majestuosamente su manto de nieve.  A pesar de estar muy cerca del nevado, Latacunga tiene una temperatura promedio de 12°C y un clima templado-frío. Es una de las ciudades más importantes de la sierra ecuatoriana gracias al desarrollo sostenido que se dio a partir de los inicios del siglo XXI.  Actualmente Latacunga cuenta con alrededor de 63.842 habitantes. El clima y condiciones no sólo geográficas sino también atmosféricas han permitido que el negocio florícola de la zona crezca y se convierta en el motor económico y un importante generador de divisas de la Sierra Centro del Ecuador.

La minería es otra actividad que sostiene a Latacunga, la extracción de caliza y cemento además del crecimiento de la industria metalúrgica liviana y pesada, la agroindustria, la muy conocida industria lechera y ganadera han hecho de esta ciudad una de las muchas ciudades ecuatorianas que promete avances extraordinarios. En la actualidad cuenta con su propio aeropuerto internacional y un crecimiento urbano impresionante que cuenta con grandes mercados y centros comerciales.

En la tranquila parroquia de Eloy Alfaro encontramos a Cecilia, una madre emprendedora que cada día lucha por darle lo mejor a su familia. Desde hace tres años brinda servicios de belleza, dedica alrededor de 4 horas diarias a su trabajo ya que luego tiene que encargarse de su familia. Trabaja de manera ambulante brindando este servicio. Ella vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo Juan de 44 años que ayuda a los gasto del hogar con su trabajo de guardia privado. A sus 38 años, uno de los obstáculos que Cecilia ha tenido que superar es iniciar su negocio y sustentar las bases necesarias para que funcione y crezca como ella espera. Posicionarse en el mercado es difícil,  pero ella espera que con la ayuda de Fundación Alternativa, institución mediadora entre Kiva, pueda comprar productos e implementos de belleza y con ello mejorar su servicio y tener más clientes. A futuro espera poder abrir su propio salón de belleza y así mejorar sus ingresos, ella desea darle lo mejor a su familia y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Latacunga, the capital of the province of Cotopaxi, is a beautiful city located on the lower slopes of the dormant volcano Cotopaxi, which rises majestically to its snow-capped peak.  In spite of being very close to the snow, Latacunga has an average temperature of 12°C (54°F) and a mild-to-cool climate.  It is one of the most important cities of the equatorial sierra, thanks to the sustained development which started at the beginning of the 21st century.  Currently Latacunga has around 63,842 residents.  The climate, along with not only the geographic conditions, but also the atmospheric conditions, has permitted the flower-growing industry to grow and become the economic engine of the region and bring in substantial foreign currency to the Central Sierra of Ecuador.

Mining is the other activity that sustains Latacunga.  The extraction of limestone and concrete, heavy and light metallurgy, agro-industry, and the well-known dairy and livestock industry have all enabled this city to become one of the many Ecuadoran cities that hold the promise of extraordinary growth.  The city now has its own international airport and impressive urban growth, complete with large markets and commercial centers.

In the tranquil parish of Eloy Alfaro we find Cecilia, an enterprising mother who fights every day to give the best to her family.  For three years she has been providing beautician services.  She spends roughly four hours each day in her work, since afterward she has to take care of her family.  She travels from home to home to perform this week.  She lives with her two children and her husband Juan, who is 44 years old.  He helps with the household expenses and earns his living as a private guard.  

At her 38 years, one of the obstacles that Cecilia has had to overcome is to start her business and do all that is necessary to maintain it so that it will function and grow as she wants it to.  To position oneself in the market is difficult, but she hopes that with the help of Fundación Alternativa, an institution that works with Kiva, she will be able to buy beauty products and supplies and thus be able to improve her service and have more clients.  In the future she hopes to be able to open her own beauty salon and thus improve her income.  She wants to provide the best for her family and be able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and supplies.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 54 years old. He is married and lives in a small village of Zestafoni District with his family: his wife – Khatuna, his parents, who are pensioners and his 19-year-old daughter. Avtandil and Khatuna run an agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 milking cows and produce cheese. Part of the cheese is used by the family members and the rest is sold on the local open market. They own a vineyard as well; they work hard during spring and summer seasons on their plot to get a good harvest. They pick grapes in fall and produce wine, which is sold in nearby villages.

Avtandil requested a loan to construct a greenhouse for vegetables. This will enable him to grow vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers and greens) during the entire year. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income Avtandil and Khatuna will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make more profitable. Taking into account the above-mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lolita hopes to be able to expand soon. She also hopes to buy her own vehicle. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and piglets

loans.name: Virgen De Los Dolores Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres es de la ciudad de Ybycui, está integrado por 11 mujeres, todas ellas amigas de esa ciudad. Son mujeres con ganas de salir adelante y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a sus familias.
Adalbina forma parte del grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de bebidas, en lo cual le está yendo muy bien. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación está saliendo adelante y de esa forma ayuda a su familia. Su meta es poder salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, como ser gaseosas, vinos, cervezas, whiskys y demás. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group meets in the city of Ybycuí and is comprised of 11 women, all of whom are friends from this city.  These women all desire to make economic progress and to be able to help their families.

Adalbina is a member of this group, and she sells all types of beverages.  Her business is going very well.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she is making progress and is able to help support her family, which is her goal.

She is seeking this loan to buy a variety of beverages, such as soda, wine, beer, whiskey and more.  She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the loan opportunity.

loans.use: to buy beverages for resale.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Comité "Niño", es un Comité más del Programa Comité de Mujeres Rurales de la Fundación Paraguaya, actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo y con mucho esfuerzo y lucha están saliendo adelante.
María es la presidenta del grupo, y nos cuenta que siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras del grupo a ser mejores y a que, de esa forma vayan superando los desafíos que se presentan. María se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano, en lo que le está yendo muy bien, ya que están siendo muy solicitadas estas prendas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano, las cuales podrán seguir ofreciendo una mejor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group "Niño Jesus", is another communal bank associated with the Rural Women's Committee of the Fundación Paraguaya.  Currently they are in their second loan cycle.  With great efforts, they are making economic progress.

María is the president of the group.  She tells us that she always tries to motivate her fellow members to do their best, and in this way be able to overcome the challenges that they face. María sells second-hand clothing, and her business is going very well, as these items are in much demand.

She is seeking the loan in order to buy more second-hand clothing, which will allow her to offer greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 55 years old; she lives in a small village of Terjola District with her family: her son – George, her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (1 and 3 years old). Her son works in the Security Police and gets a monthly salary; her daughter-in-law looks after her children and Liana is busy with the agricultural business. In particular, she has three milking cows and one pig. Liana milks the cows twice a day and produces cheese. Part of it is used by the family and the rest is sold locally.

In addition to her small dairy farm, she is busy with farming also. Liana owns a vineyard. She works hard on her plot to get a good harvest. In fall she picks grapes and sells them in Zestafoni, on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari.

Liana requested a loan to repair her house, because the existing one is old and uncomfortable. After repairing the house, the family will have better living conditions. They will be able to spend their evenings after hard working days in a more comfortable area. Liana hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
This is Benilda. She previously accessed a 38,000 PHP loan that she used in buying more quantities of perfume products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 42,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of beads, lace, cords and other accesories needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 


Benilda hopes to be able to expand soon. She also hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of beads, lace, cords and other accesories

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is 52 years old; she lives in a small village of Zestafoni District with her family: her daughter – Tea, her son-in-law, her mother-in-law and two grandchildren. Her son-in-law works in glass factory and gets a monthly salary; her mother-in-law is a pensioner, and Makvala is busy with agricultural business. She has two milking cows, one calf and one pig. Makvala produces cheese and sells it in nearby villages. She also is busy with farming. She owns 0.6 hectares of land, where nuts are grown. In late summer, the family picks nuts and sells them in Zestafoni, on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Lari. They work hard, but still don’t have enough income to put aside some savings for purchasing additional household goods or renovation of the house. 

Makvala requested a loan to repair her house and purchase a garage. After repairing the house and purchasing the garage Makvala will be able to create better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to repair her house and to purchase a garage

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es:
Lleny tiene 48 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Está casada con Eduardo, el padre de sus tres hijos. 
Su actividad es la venta de abarrotes. Tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa donde tiene a la venta productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, arroz, aceites, gaseosas, golosinas y otros.  Inició hace más de 14 años y hasta el momento cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja, quien le facilitó el capital con lo que logró comprar los primeros productos, en pocas cantidades, después fue creciendo de a pocos y aumentando ventas. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite estar en casa y cuidar de sus nietos menores, a los que quiere mucho. Tiene planes de continuar, ya que esta es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a todos sus miembros y no tiene problemas con ninguno de ellos.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros, a precio por mayor, para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Lleny, 48, is a hard-working woman with big hopes of getting ahead.  She is married to Eduardo and they had three children.

Her business is selling groceries and she has a small store in her house where she offers basic products such as sugar, rice, oils, soft drinks, sweets and more.  She started the business more than 14 years ago and she has had her husband’s support.  He gave the money so that she could buy her basic products in small quantities and later sales began to increase slowly.  She likes the business because it allows her to be home and care for her young grandchildren whom she loves very much. She has plans to continue since this is her main source of income.

This will be her first loan with MFP and she hopes to be able to continue with her goals.  Besides she says that it’s nice to be in a communal bank since she knows all the members and doesn’t have problems with any of them.

She will use the money requested to buy items wholesale such as rice, sugar, oil, and more to supply her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries (sugar, oil, rice, etc) to supply her store

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Juanita hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Con 31,500 pesos Julio Cesar, podrá comprar más mercancía para su tienda de comestibles. Julio César inició en este negocio hace poco más de un año luego de perder su empleo teniendo un bebé casi recien nacido. Tomando unos ahorros y la compensación por desempleo que recibió decidió abrir una tienda de comestible. Ya el niño tiene 18 meses y su tienda marcha muy bien, con ella puede sustentar a su familia. Su esposa es ama de casa, se dedica a cuidar al niño y a veces le da una manito en la tienda.
El deseo de Julio Cesar es que su negocio continue marchando bien, ya que no quiere volver a ser empleado, sino él mismo tener el control de sus finanzas en sus manos.
texts.en:
Julio César will be able to buy more merchandise for his grocery store with 31,500 pesos. Julio César has been in this business for a little over one year after having lost his job and has a recently born baby. He took some of his savings and unemployment compensation that he received and decided ot open a grocery store. 

Now the child is 18 months old and his store has done very well. With the store he is able to support his family. His wife is a housewife who cares for the child and helps out with the store from time to time.

Julio César's dream is that business continues doing well as he does not want to return to being an employee, but wants to have the control of his finances in his own hands.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 56, resident of Payatas, Philippines. Yoland is single and manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Yolanda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, Yolanda also sells direct-selling products to her customer. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Yolanda is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business. 

Yolanda hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of opening a restaurant someday. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to change her embroidery machine and purchase a variety of nice quality fabrics.

loans.name: Tavita

texts.es:
Tavita tiene 30 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa. Está casada con Ciro, quien es agricultor. Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos de 9 y 4  años, a los que quiere mucho. La casa donde viven la heredó de sus padres.

Su actividad es la siembra de frutas y verduras regionales como piñas, limones, naranjas, tomates y otros; así también la venta de frutas frescas. Para eso cuenta con un puesto en el mercado de su localidad. Lleva dedicándose a este negocio hace más de 12  años, contando con el apoyo de su pareja y dos peones para la siembra y cosecha de sus productos. Le gusta su negocio, pues está acostumbrada a esa actividad, pues la aprendió de sus padres, además de los ingresos económicos que le permiten solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Por lo contrario, no le gusta es el cansancio físico que le genera por cada día de larga jornada de trabajo, por eso se toma descansos de hasta dos días y vuelve a su negocio. Su deseo es de tener más ingresos para diversificar sus siembras.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente contenta con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues los considera personas amables y responsables.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en el pago a sus peones para el cultivo de su terreno, la cosecha de sus productos (limones, piñas mandarinas, entre otros) y para el traslado al mercado.
texts.en:
Tavita is 30 years old. She is a very hard-working and dedicated woman. She is married to Ciro, who is a farmer. She lives together with her husband and her children, aged 9 and 4, whom she loves very much. The house where they live was inherited from her parents. 

Her work is growing fruits and vegetables of the region, such as pineapples, limes, oranges, tomatoes and others, as well as selling fresh fruits. For this, she has a stand in the market of her town. She has been working in this business for more than 12 years, with the support of her husband and two laborers to plant and harvest her crops. She likes her business, because she is accustomed to this work, since she learned it from her parents. She also likes the income, which allows her to cover the expenses of her household and her children's education. On the other hand, she doesn't like the physical tiredness that comes after a long day of work. For this reason she takes rest periods of up to two days and then returns to her business. Her desire is to have more income in order to diversify her crops. 

This is her second loan with the MFP institution, and she feels happy about the opportunity to have a line of credit to move forward with her business. She also feels good about her communal bank, since she considers the members to be friendly and responsible people. 

With the amount she is requesting, 1000 Peruvian new soles, she will invest in paying her laborers to cultivate her land, to harvest her products (limes, pineapples and mandarines, among others), and to transport them to the market.

loans.use: to pay the laborers who will work her lands and help her bring her products to market.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aveolela

texts.en: Aveolela is 20 years old and married with no children. She runs a small business that sells pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Aveolela has requested a loan to buy flours, sugar, yeast and other items. She joined SPBD in 2012 to help her grow her business. With her earnings, Aveolela will expand her business and renovate her building.

loans.use: To buy baking supplies for her business

loans.name: Erminia

texts.en:
This is Erminia. She previously received a loan of 8,000 PHP. She used the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages in order to expand her product inventory. Her earnings helped pay for some of her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 10,000 PHP so that she can buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. 

Erminia hopes to expand her business soon and aspires to own her own home. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with a heart of happiness and thankfulness. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work each week. These groups also allow her to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Wangninan 16 Group

texts.fr: WANGNINAN 16 est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres habitent ensemble dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un crédit. La représentante du groupe, Ahoudjo (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Gbèhounou. Ahoudjo est mère de quatre enfants, dont aucun scolarisé et aucun à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Ahoudjo n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Ahoudjo vend de l’huile de palme et des boules de pâtes (faites à base de l'amidon du maïs) à son domicile. Ahoudjo achète ses produits dans sa région. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus forte de sa clientèle, Ahoudjo ensemble avec les autres du groupe WANGNINAN 16 sollicitent pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: "Wangninan 16" is a group comprising four people who live together in the same area and belong to the same tontine. In order to raise the level of their business and meet their customers' demands, this group joined ALIDÉ with the goal of obtaining a loan. The group leader, Ahoudjo (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old and married to a farmer named Gbèhounou. Ahoudjo is the mother of four children, none of whom attend school. The children live together with their parents. Ahoudjo did not attend school. For about twenty years, Ahoudjo has sold palm oil and doughballs (made from corn starch) at her home. She buys her products in the area. With the goal of raising her business and better responding to the increasingly growing demand of her clientele, Ahoudjo is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ along with the other members of the Wangninan 16 group. The three previous loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy maize and palm nuts.

loans.name: Fifatin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFATIN est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Charlotte, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Charlotte est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Saliou. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Charlotte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Afin de contribuer aux charges de la maison, Charlotte vend des cartes de recharges et des amuses gueules dans son quartier. Charlotte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Charlotte exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Charlotte désire obtenir un deuxième financement, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFATIN. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
