texts.en: The "Fifatin" group comprises three people who live in the same area. The group leader, named Charlotte, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of raising the level of their business. Charlotte is 36 years old and married to a man named Saliou. The couple have three children, all of whom attend school and are in their parents' care. Charlotte lives together with her husband and children. The couple provide for the family together. In order to contribute to the household expenses, Charlotte sells rechargeable phone cards and snacks in her area. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. Charlotte has run this business for five years. With the goal of strengthening her business and better responding to the demands of her clientele, Charlotte would like to obtain a second loan together with the other members of the Fifatin group. The previous loan was repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone cards and bags of wheat to make finger foods.

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pauline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pauline est âgée de 38 ans. Pauline a très peu fréquenté l’école et est mariée à un certain Hervé. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. le couple assure ensemble les besoins du ménage. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de son ménage, Pauline vend divers produits (haricot, pâtes alimentaires et conserves) dans sa boutique. Pauline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire et leur revenu, Pauline et son groupe sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The "Fifa" group comprises three people who live in the same area. The group leader, named Pauline, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Pauline is 38 years old. She had very little schooling and is married to a man named Hervé. The couple have three children, all of whom attend school and are in their parents' care. The children live together with their parents. The couple provide for the family together. In order to contribute to the various household expenses, Pauline sells various items (beans, pasta, and canned goods) at her store. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin and has run this business for seven years. With the goal of raising the level of their business and increasing their sales and income, Pauline and her group are seeking a second loan with ALIDÉ. The first loan was repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, pasta, and beans.

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: BIDOSSESSI est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Mathilde Patricia (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Alphonse. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mathilde Patricia vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Afin de parvenir aux diverses charges familiales, Mathilde Patricia vend des céréales à son domicile. Mathilde Patricia s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Mathilde Patricia sollicite un financement de ALIDé ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BIDOSSESSI en vue de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à rehausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The "Bidossessi" group comprises four people who live together in the same area. The group leader, Mathilde Patricia (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 43 years old and married to a man named Alphonse. The couple have four children, all of whom attend school and are in their parents' care. Mathilde Patricia lives together with her children and husband. The couple provide for the family together. In order to meet the various household expenses, Mathilde Patricia sells cereals at her home. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. This is the first time Mathilde Patricia is seeking a loan with ALIDÉ together with the other members of the Bidossessi group, with the goal of strengthening their business and better satisfying their customers. This loan will definitely allow them to raise the level of their business and earn higher profits.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Zhana

texts.en:
Zhana is 29 years old. She lives in a small village in the Kharagauli District with her parents, husband, Aleksander, and three children, ages 12, 14 and 16 years old. Aleksander serves in the military and receives a monthly salary. Her parents receive a pension and her children go to the village school. 

Zhana is busy with an agricultural business. She has seven milking cows, seven valves, two pigs and two bulls. Zhana milks cows twice a day and produces cheese, which is then sold to the cheese merchant. The family also owns 0.8 hectare of land, where nuts are grown. They sell nuts on the local open market. 

Zhana requested a loan in order to renovate the house. The existing house is old and uncomfortable. After renovating the house, the family will be able to spend their evenings after hard-working days in a more comfortable area. As a result, Zhana will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair the house.

loans.name: Jesulome Group

texts.fr: JESULOME est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Akouavi Joséphine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans. Akouavi Joséphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école et est mariée  à un certain Ange. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les diverses du ménage. Akouavi Joséphine,  pour subvenir aux besoins,  vend depuis près quinze ans, des friperies de façon ambulante. Akouavi Joséphine s'approvisionne dans dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et  pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Akouavi Joséphine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Akouavi Joséphine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESULOME. Les deux crédits consentis ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The "Jesulome" group comprises three people who live in the same area. The group leader, Akouavi Joséphine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 48 years old. Akouavi Joséphine did not attend school and is married to a man named Ange. The couple have four children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their parents' care. The couple live together with their children and provide for the household together. To provide for the family, Akouavi Joséphine has sold second-hand clothing door-to-door for close to fifteen years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of expanding her business and being more competitive in the market, Akouavi Joséphine wants to increase her stock of products; this will allow her to raise her sales and income. For this reason, she is seeking a third loan with ALIDÉ together with the other members of the Jesulome group. The two previous loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Mere

texts.en:
Mere is a 70-year-old widow with eight children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Mere has requested a loan in order to buy such equipment as a rake, knife, fertilizer and weed killer. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Mere hopes to expand her plantation and renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy farming tools in order to grow taro and bananas.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a businessman from the city of Hato Mayor, an agricultural city surrounded by valleys and mountains. He makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and their four children. This entrepreneurial man is dedicated to selling meat and vegetables. He has been running his butcher shop since the first loan he took out from Esperanza Internacional, almost eight years ago. He plans to use this loan to purchase pork, beef and different types of vegetables. 

Jose is excited to be taking out this loan from Esperanza after successfully repaying his previous loans and growing his business. All through the years since starting his business, his life and the lives of his family members have experienced change. He will use his profits to support his family and to improve his business. 

Jose thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy meat and vegetables

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been married to Crispus for 28 years; they have six children.

In 1996, with help from her husband, who is a farmer, Margaret decided to open her own sewing workshop. She currently makes uniforms for the school-going children because of good relations that she has with the school. As a result, Margaret has a lot of customers who always come back to her.

She already owns sewing machines but would like to continue expanding her business by adding more sewing machines, since there is a lot of demand for her work.

Margaret is seeking a loan to buy sewing machines and also the other supplies she is going to need to make clothing.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and other supplies for her clothing business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina  es  una persona  trabajadora  y  muy responsable  la  cual  tiene  una  tienda  de  abarrotes este  le permite  generar  ingresos  para  salir  adelante, en este  momento ella  requiere  realizar  la  compra  de  mercancía  para  su  negocio, ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de hacer crecer  su   negocio además de  seguir  ofreciendo  a sus clientes  el excelente servicio que  la caracteriza.
texts.en: Josefina is a hard-working and responsible person who has a grocery store. This allows her to generate income to advance. At this time she needs to purchase merchandise for her business. She sees in the loan the possibility to make her business grow, in addition to continuing to offer her customers the excellent service that characterizes her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to update her old sewing machines and buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Idah

texts.en: Idah is a 53-year-old lady from Nyamasaria, Kisumu city. She is widowed and currently takes care of her four grandchildren. Idah operates a water selling point. She has been in this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings. She joined KADET Ltd recently and has now qualified for a first loan, which she will use to build a structure for the water point. Her profits will be used to boost her pharmacy business. Her dream is to be successful in business.

loans.use: to build a structure for the water selling point.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es: Juan  es  una persona  que  se  preocupa  por  acondicionar  la vivienda  que  con esfuerzos  adquirió,  el  se  acerco  con nosotros  ya  que  en este momento desea  comprar   una puerta  para  el exterior  de su  vivienda, ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de que  su  hogar  se encuentre  protegido y  así cuando  salga  a   trabajar  lo hará  de una manera  mas  tranquila  , agradece el apoyo brindado  para la realización de su  proyecto.
texts.en: Juan worries about being able to equip the house that his hard work helped him acquire. He came to us because right now he wants to buy an exterior door for his house. He saw in the loan the possibility that his home could be protected and when he goes to work he will feel calmer. He is grateful for the support given to him to make this project happen.

loans.use: to buy a door for his house.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a very efficient lady. She is illiterate but she is very responsible and performs her household responsibilities very well. She has given birth to seven children: two of them are working and two of them are studying. Her husband works in the field and grows different seasonal crops.

Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With this loan investment, he will buy seeds and fertilizers, etc., in larger quantities to be able to produce better crops and increase his income. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Kosar is confident that this loan will help make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for a farming business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas
Fray Casiano Puntarenas
2012-178


	Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas presenta la solicitud de crédito de 6 integrantes,  quienes han trabajan en una comunidad de Puntarenas (Fray Casiano) con altos niveles de pobreza. El  grupo de mujeres en la zona mantiene un  ahorro y participan en las actividades grupales para la generación de ingresos.  Tienen 8 años de trabajar en sus actividades, han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.1 de formación del Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas. 

	Su trabajo y esfuerzo,  les ha permitido tener su  actividad consolidada como es el  comercio en general (venta de ropa, zapatos, perfumes y otros).  El préstamo va a contribuir a mejorar las condiciones de trabajo de su grupo,  les va a permitir invertir para medio año, incrementando su inventario y cubriendo pedidos para la  época de vacaciones de medio año y día de la madre.

	 Realizan la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio del pago a realizar, la cual se comprometen a cancelar en un período de 8 meses. 

Algunas de ellas son mujeres jefas de hogar y madres solteras, además de atender sus actividades económicas por las tardes, también ven  a sus hijos y  cumplen con  las reuniones grupales. 

	El objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de sus empresas, obteniendo un financiamiento acorde con sus necesidades y apoyar el desarrollo de la zona  y por su puesto  mejorar la calidad de vida  de las familias. El nombre del grupo las motiva a ser mejores cada día, Mujeres Esforzadas.
texts.en:
The “Women's Bank of Vigorous [Enterprising] Women” is presenting this request for loans for its 6 members, who work in the community of Fray Casiano in Puntarenas with its high levels of poverty. The women's group maintains savings accounts and participates in group activities inj their zone to generate income. The members have been working in various types of activities for 8 years, having requested loans in the past. They understand how the group can work together and have formed a Directing Committee and drafted “Act No. 1” to form the “Women's Bank of Vigorous Women”. 

Hard work and much effort has allowed them to consolidate their activities in general commerce, including selling clothing, shoes, perfumes and other things. The loan will contribute to improving the group's working conditions, allowing them to invest for another half year, increasing their inventory, and covering orders for the mid-year vacation period and Mothers Day.

They plan to recover their investment in weekly payments. This will permit them to enjoy a more ample profit margin. They promise to retire their debt within a period of 8 months. 

Some of the women are heads of households and single mothers. In addition to carrying out their economic activities during the afternoons, they also must care for their children and attend group reunions. 

Their objective is to improve the condition of their enterprises, obtaining financing according to their needs and helping in the development of the zone. They also wish to improve their families' quality of life. The group's name motivates them to be better “Enterprising Women” every day.

loans.use: purchase clothing, shoes, and perfumes, among other products, to sell during mid-year vacation season and for Mothers Day.

loans.name: Mekhman

texts.en:
Mekhman is 30 years old and married to Nargiza. He lives in a small village in the Gardabani District. 

They run a small dairy farm with four milking cows. They milk cows twice a day and produce cheese, which they sell on the local open market. They also have calves that they grow and sell after several months for a good price. In addition to his agricultural activities, Mekhman is a construction worker. He works on construction sites from time to time and receives remuneration. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Lari. 

Mekhman requested a loan in order to purchase calves. He will purchase calves to feed and raise. In winter, grown calves can be sold for a good price. Mekhman plans to increase the income of the family. With the additional income, he will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business, expand it and make it more profitable. This will lead to better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en:
Moa is 39 years old, married and has five children. 

She creates and sells materials with Elei printing and other Samoan handicrafts to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Moa has requested a loan in order to buy screen prints, materials, paint, brushes and other items. She plans to use her profits to renovate her house and assist in the betterment of the business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, paint, brushes and others items for printing.

loans.name: Blanca Raquel

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la venta de enchape, sandalias, flores artificiales, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella vive en una casa propiedad de su tía, ella desempeña múltiples actividades de comercializar y además presta los servicios de lavar y planchar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para elaborar flores artificiales, como papel de diferentes colores, alambre de amarre, pega, espelma, tambien comprara prendas enchapadas en aretes, pulseras, anillos, esto mejorara la atención a los clientes ofreciéndoles una mejor variedad en joyas enchapadas, además contara con los materiales para iniciar la elaboración de flores.
La aspiración de Blanca es poder apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio, por medio de su negocio, además a futuro poder contar con su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca sells jewelry, sandals and artificial flowers. She lives with her husband and two children in a home owned by her aunt. She has multiple businesses and also offers laundering services.

She requests a loan for materials to make artificial flowers, like different colored paper, wire, glue and wax. She will also buy plated earrings, bracelets and rings which will increase the attention of her customers by offering a greater variety of plated jewelry. She also will have the materials to start making flowers.

Blanca's goal with her business is to be able to support her kids in their studies and, in the future, to own a home.

loans.use: to buy colored paper, wire, glue, wax.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 43 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Su pareja es Elmer, quien trabaja como estibador. Vive en compañía de su padre, su madre, su pareja y sus tres hijos de 19, 15 y 5 años, quienes son su motivación. Habitan en la casa que construyó en un terreno que le cedió su primo.

Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes que implementó en su vivienda, donde ofrece los principales productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar,  fideos, avena, etc. Inició hace más de 3 años con la ayuda de su pareja, de quien fue la idea y con un capital propio, fruto de sus ahorros, más un pequeño préstamo, logró comprar los primeros productos en pocas cantidades, logrando crecer de a poco con un rotación constante de su mercadería. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite estar en casa y cuidar de sus hijos menores, así como por los ingresos económicos para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que muchas veces no les alcanzaba. Tiene planes de ampliar la diversidad de sus productos, para así tener mayor preferencia de sus clientes; e incursionar en un nuevo negocio de venta de comida por las noches.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Además, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a todos sus miembros, no tiene problemas con ninguno de ellos, teniendo una relación de amistad con todos.

Del monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, una  parte (800) la invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes (aceite, arroz, azúcar, entre otros), y con el saldo comprará utensilios de cocina como ollas, platos, cucharas, para abrir su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to excel. Her partner is Elmer, who works as a stevedore. She lives with her father, her mother, her partner, and their three children, ages 19, 15, and 5, who are her motivation. They live in the house that he built on a plot of land that was given to him by a cousin.

She has a grocery store that she set up in her home, where she offers the principal products that are basic necessities, such as rice, sugar, pasta, oats, etc. She began it more than three years ago with the help of her partner, who had the idea and his own capital, the fruit of his savings, along with a small loan. She managed to buy the first products in small quantities, managing to grew little by little with a constant rotation of her merchandise. She likes her business, because it allows her to be at home and care for her younger children, as well as for the income to assist her partner with the household expenses, since many times they didn't have enough. She has plans to expand the variety of her products, to better attract customers, and to enter into a new business, selling food in the evenings.

This is her second loan with the MFP institution, therefore she hopes to continue toward her goals. In addition, she comments that she is happy in her communal bank, since she knows all its members. She doesn't have problems with any of them, since she has a friendly relation with everyone.

Of the amount she is applying for, 1000 PEN, she will invest part (800 PEN) in the purchase of more groceries (oil, rice, and sugar, among other items), and with the rest she will buy kitchen utensils such as pots, plates, and spoons to open her new business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store and kitchen utensils to begin her new business, selling food

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Verónica, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio de mariscos, su intención es mantener un buen nivel de venta con sus clientes, para esto debe comprarse pescado, camarones, conchas, y otros productos del mar que son demandados por sus clientes, pues le permitira también ofrecer productos frescos de calidad.

El préstamo anterior dio un efecto positivo negocio ya que logró invertir y mantener un buen nivel de producto fresco, considera que han crecido su número de clientes y en su familia tiene un hijo recién nacido.
texts.en:
Veronica is asking for a new loan to be able to invest in her seafood business. Her intention is to maintain a good level of customer sales, so she needs to buy fish, shrimp, conch and other products of the sea that are in demand by her customers. This will allow her to offer fresh, quality products.

The previous loan had a positive impact on her business because she was able to buy and maintain a good level of fresh product. She feels that her number of customers has increased. She has a newborn baby in the family.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp and conch.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married with four children and only three children go to school. She has a food stall and has been in this business for six years.  She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings to buy more tomatoes, Irish potatoes, cassava, pumpkins, yams, and banana clusters. She generates additional income through peasant farming.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to seeing her business of owning a fully stocked food stall and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.   Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, pumpkins, Irish potatoes, cassava, yams, and banana clusters

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 72 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos. Ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace tres años de productos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, consomé, entre otros. También, se dedica a comercializar ropa, que es su fuerte a la señora le ayuda una hija con el negocio.

Ella se traslada a comprar los productos hasta una ciudad que esta a 120 kilómetros de distancia, una vez al mes. La ropa la vende de manera ambulante en la comunidad. 

Doña María solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más productos para surtir la tienda y para comprar ropa. Esto le ayudara a disponer de más productos para salir a vender y aumentar su negocio. Con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y contar con un negocio más fuerte y estable.
texts.en:
Maria, 72, has five children. She has a small store where for three years she has sold basic goods like rice, beans, sugar, corn, soup and other things. She also sells clothing, which is her strength because her daughter helps with the business.

She goes to a city 120 km away to buy products once a month. She sells the clothing door-to-door in her community.

Maria asks for a loan from Fundacion Campo to buy more products to stock her store, as well as to buy clothing. This will help her have more products to go out and sell and increase her business. Her goal is to improve her quality of life and have a more stable and strong business.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store, and to buy clothing.

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adela, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de la comida, manteniendo mejores niveles de productos como lo es gaseosas, jugos, carnes, arroz, pollos, condimentos, aceite, pues todos estos materiales son utilizados a diario en la elaboración de los menús.
El efecto que tuvo préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que la inversion que realizo en la compra todos los materiales para poder subsistir en el negocio de la tienda, con este progreso ha logrado instalar el negocio de la venta de comida, considera que están mejorando sus condiciones como comerciante y al mismo tiempo los ingresos para su familia están mejorando, ya que cuenta con una nueva actividad de la cual ha obtenido ganancias, además ha hecho mejora su vivienda.
texts.en:
Adela is asking for a new loan to buy ingredients to make food and maintain a good stock of products like sodas, juices, meats, rice, chickens, condiments and oil because she uses all of these daily in making her meals.

The previous loan had a positive effect, because she invested in all the materials she needs to sustain her business. With this progress she has been able to start selling prepared food. She thinks that she is improving her business and at the same time increasing her family's income because she has a new way to earn money. She has also made improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, meat, rice, chickens, condiments, oil.

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael is married and has 2 children all of whom are still in primary school. They live at their own house that has piped water but no electricity. 

Abigael operates a food stall business. She began this business with some money that she had saved.
In addition to having the food stall business, Abigael also sells goat meat. With the money she earns from this business, she is able to cover the household costs and provide for her children's education.
She explains that the only way of being able to develop the business is through loans, since it is very difficult to secure sufficient capital through other means. It is for this reason that she has requested the loan. She is a very responsible person, who wants to succeed. She has a jovial spirit and is enterprising.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, noodles, sugar, and other basic foods and also a goat for meat sale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen. She previously accessed a 12,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in covering their personal and household expenses and buying more quantities of raw materials.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Carmen hopes to buy her own sewing machine and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy cloth for making rugs and doormats.

loans.name: Aituava

texts.en:
Aituava is a 38-year-old married woman with three children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, yams, etc., to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. Aituava  has requested a loan to purchase chemicals, crops, knives and rakes.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Aituava hopes to improve her plantation business and wants to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more crops and purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 47 years old, married and a mother of 7 kids. They live in Montol, Ozamis City. Helen provides computer services such as encoding and printing. With this business, she gets a monthly income of 2,000 PHP. Helen has been doing this for 5 years. Currently, she is in need of buying printing paper and other supplies, so she has asked for a loan of 1,700 PHP. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. She is planning for business expansion one day.

loans.use: to buy printing paper and other supplies

loans.name: Tolu

texts.en: Tolu is a 22-year-old married woman with no children. She makes and sells BBQ in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Tolu needs a loan to buy chicken, sausage, potatoes, soya, plastic plates, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her BBQ business and to renovate her house. Tolu has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, potatoes, a box of sausages, plastic plates, etc.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús  de 62 años vive en Puerto Colombia, un municipio ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe; en esta población de importante potencial turístico  y pueblo de mucha paz, él tiene una fábrica de bollos, o amasijo de maíz, envuelto con capachos, u hojas que protegen el fruto y al que en ocasiones agregan queso o anís, miel etc. Su experiencia data de hace 20 años y siempre contando con el apoyo de su esposa, quien le ayuda a preparar diariamente, los llamados bollos limpios, al que solo le agrega masa de maíz natural, productos muy saludable ,porque no contiene conservantes, saborizantes artificiales. Los principales acompañantes de este producto son las tortillas de huevos, chicharrones, pescado frito y justamente los principales clientes de  estos productos, son los negocios que se dedican a la venta de alimentos o restaurantes y amas de casa cuyas familias lo consumen a la hora del desayuno principalmente. La Jornada de trabajo de Jesús, comienza a las 3:00 a.m. con la molienda, armado, cocción y finaliza con la distribución  de los bollos aun calientes, con los que transita por las polvorientas calles del municipio. Actualmente Jesús está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará maíz en un mayor volumen, pues desea extender su mercado y necesita aumentar su producción, mientras sus indicadores financieros indican un importante potencial de crecimiento, ampliando su mercado, pues maneja un margen de utilidad no menor del 40% y sus materias primas rotan cada 5 días, indicadores desde los que auguramos su crecimiento empresarial. Jesús afirma orgullosamente que su vivienda y todo lo que posee se lo debe a sus bollos, por eso quiere que cuando muera,  lo recuerden como el fabricante de los más exquisitos bollos que se producen en Puerto Colombia, municipio de Playa, brisa y mar, que es lo más lindo de la tierra linda, como lo afirma un canción que inspiró a su autor en el Caribe.
texts.en:
Jesus is 62 years old and lives in Puerto Colombia, a town located on the coast of the Caribbean Sea.  In this town of important touristic potential and  peacefulness, he makes bollos (a spongy bread roll made of corn) wrapped in leaves for protection which are occasionally flavored with cheese, anise, honey, etc.

His experience dates back 20 years, and he has always had the support of his wife who helps the daily preparation of the plain bollos.  They are made with natural corn flour and healthy products that do not contain preservatives or artificial flavors.  The bollos are typically eaten with egg tortillas, pork rinds, or fried fish.  The main customers of Jesus's products are businesses that sell food or restaurants and housewives whose customers and family eat them for breakfast.  

Jesus's daily schedule begins at 3:00 am with the milling of the corn, followed by the preparation and baking of the dough, and finally the distribution of the warm bollos through the dusty streets of the town.  

Presently, Jesus is applying for his first loan from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Mario Santo Domingo Foundation) with which he will buy corn in a larger quantity.  He hopes to extend his market, and he needs to increase his production as his financial indicators show an important potential for growth.  He maintains a profit margin of no less than 40% and his raw materials cycle every five days- indicators which foretell business growth.  

Jesus proudly asserts that his home and everything that he owns is owed to the production of his bollos.  That is why he hopes that when he dies, his business is remembered for the most exquisite bollos made in Puerto Colombia- town of the beach, breeze, and sea that is the loveliest of all the lovely earth, as affirms a song that inspired its author in the Caribbean.

loans.use: to buy corn in a larger quantity.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Francisco, él pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue dedicándose a la mecánica automotriz, y es esta actividad la que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para implementar su taller comprando herramientas y repuestos para su taller mecánico.
Francisco está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
El socio agrradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Francisco is a member of the communal bank "Sol Naciente" (Rising Sun) in the city of Cusco, Peru.  He works as an auto mechanic which allows him to help his family get ahead.  

Francisco will invest the loan in improving his repair shop by buying tools and spare parts.  He is very thankful to Kiva for allowing him to continue his business and support his family.  He is thankful for the loan, and he promises to make all of his payments according to his schedule of payments.

loans.use: to buy spare automotive parts and tools for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo de 54 años, vive con su cónyuge y se dedica con su hermano a la ebanistería; tienen un taller donde fabrican todo tipo de muebles en madera. Su negocio lo heredaron por tradición de su abuelo, de quien aprendieron las tareas propias de este oficio al cual hoy están dedicados completamente.  Su principal clientela es tradicional, pues proviene de hace muchos años y también han conformado una base de datos de referidos por estos mismos, a quienes ha movido a comprarles, la calidad con la cual trabajan en este taller. Su meta es fortalecer su negocio y dirigir todos sus esfuerzos a su reposicionamiento, pues con la muerte de su padre, ha disminuido su capital de trabajo y para responder al crecimiento de su negocio, con el que cuentan no es suficiente para impactar su mercado con nuevos productos y respuesta rápida a su clientela, teniendo que acudir a prestamos de alto costo. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprarán materias primas como madera y una ruteadora manual, para continuar mejorando el acabado de los muebles. Su inversión  de credikiva proyecta tener éxito porque se fundamenta en la preventa realizada, en nuevos diseños que saldrán al mercado y que son de mayor rotación entre sus clientes, potencializando el incremento de las ventas y principalmente porque remplazará con un credikiva un préstamo de alto costo, que le impide tener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 54 years old, lives with his wife, and along with his brother, is a carpenter.  They have a workshop where they make all types of wood furniture.  The brothers inherited their business from their grandfather from whom they learned the skills necessary for the trade to which they are completely dedicated today.  Principally, their customers are traditional and have been loyal for many years.  Also, the brothers have formed a base of customer referrals thanks to the quality of their work.  

Their goal is to strengthen their business and to direct their efforts to repositioning themselves.  With the death of their father, their working capital has diminished.  In order to respond to growth of their business and impact the market with new products as well as respond rapidly to requests of their customers, they were forced to take out high-cost loans.  

It is for this reason that they are applying for their first loan from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Mario Santo Domingo Foundation) with which they will buy raw materials such as wood and a manual router in order to lessen the time it takes to complete their furniture.  

The loan projects to be successful because it is supported by the presale of new designs that are coming out in the market and are being rotated within customer base, thus potentially increasing their sales.  Furthermore, they will replace a high-cost loan, which would cut their profits, with this loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood and manuel router.

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
This is Cyril. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used in buying different kinds of vegetables. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cyril dreams of being able to give all her children a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sabina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sabina, Esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para darle continuidad a la venta de tortillas y de verduras, manifiesta haber recibido un buen servicio con el préstamo y esto le ha motivado a continuar trabajando como es comprar tomates, Chile, yuca, zanahoria, maíz, que son necesarios para poder mantener los dos negocios, espera de esta nueva inversión poder crecer en su atención al cliente.

Con préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo ya que  aumento del inventario de la mercadería y pudo ofrecer a sus clientes mayor cantidad de verduras, mejoró el negocio gracias al crédito de kiva, pues recibió los fondos necesarios de los cuales ha logrado trabajar y ha multiplicado sus ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Sabina is applying for a new loan so that she can keep selling tortillas and vegetables. She reports having received good service with the loan, and this has enabled her to continue working, as in buying tomatoes, chillies, yuca, carrots and corn. These are necessary for her to be able to maintain the two businesses. She hopes this new investment will enable her to expand service to her customers.

She had a positive effect with the previous loan, as she added to her merchandise inventory and was able to offer her customers a greater quantity of vegetables. She improved her business thanks to the Kiva loan, as she received the necessary funds through which she has managed to work, and has multiplied her earnings for her family.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, chillies, yuca, carrots and corn.

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es:
María, Se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio de la venta frutas comprándose sandías, mangos, piña, melón, y otras que son frutas de temporada, esto ayudará a tener una mejor disponibilidad y le ayude a poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad.

Con el préstamo anterior logró fortalecer el negocio creciendo en su clientela, ha logrado disponer de una mayor variedad, también gracias al crédito ha mejorado su situación económica en su familia estabilizándose hasta el momento.
texts.en:
María has decided to request a new loan in order to invest in her fruit sale business through the purchase of watermelon, mangoes, pineapple, melons, and other seasonal fruits. This will help her to have better availability and offer her customers greater variety. 

With the previous loan, she was able to strengthen her business, increase her clientele, and offer more variety. Also, thanks to the loan, she has improved her family’s economic situation and is stable thus far.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon, mangoes, pineapples, and melons.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Doña Marcelina tiene 44 años, es soltera por viudez, tiene 5 hijos, y vive en el Municipio de Intibuca, La Esperanza.
Doña Marcelina  se ha dedicado siempre a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de papa. este producto lo vende en sus casa hasta donde llegan los compradores, le hes muy rentable y le ha dado los recursos necesarios para seguir adelante con su familia. La zona donde Doña Marcelina vive es apta para la agricultura.
Ella ha solicitado un segundo préstamo de 20,000 lempiras para  comprar semillas, fertilizante, fungicida,preparación de la tierra, y lograr tener mejor producción en las cosechas para vender mejor producto.
Su meta es seguir mejorando los cultivos dándoles la asistencia necesaria, ya que con los financiamientos que Odef le ha proporcionado ha mejorado mucho.
texts.en:
Doña Marcelina is 44 years old and single as a result of being a widow. She has five children and lives in the town of Intibuca, La Esperanza.

Doña Marcelina has always been a farmer, specifically growing potatoes. She sells her products from home and her buyers go there to make their purchases. Her business is very profitable and it provides her with the necessary income to help her family move forward. The area where Doña Marcelina lives is suitable for agriculture.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 HNL in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, and fungicides for preparing her land so that her harvests will result in better production and a better product that she can sell. Her goal is to continue improving her crops by providing them with the necessary attention. The loans from ODEF have helped her make many improvements.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and fungicides.

loans.name: Mujeres Formales Group

texts.es:
En Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas residen tres mujeres emprendedoras que juntas formaron Mujeres Formales, JC. Santo Domingo es una ciudad de clima húmedo tropical con una temperatura promedio de 25°C . La ciudad es conocida por ser el enlace entre varias ciudades ecuatorianas tales como Esmeraldas, Cuenca, Quito entre otras haciendo de Santo Domingo un punto importante del comercio ecuatoriano. Es más, Santo Domingo abarca la mayoría del mercado ganadero del Ecuador. Se le determina “de los Tsáchilas” por ser el hogar del grupo étnico de los Tsáchilas, que mantiene tradiciones tales como vestuario y costumbres desde antes de la época de la colonia. 

Él grupo de Mujeres Formales, está compuesto por Claire, Hortensia, y Jesús. Las tres son vecinas y viven en el centro de la ciudad. Formaron un negocio de venta de cosméticos y ropa y tienen servicio de modistas. Claire es madre soltera  de un hijo, tiene 47 años, y termino sus estudios secundarios. Hortensia tiene 59 años y no tiene ningún compromiso por lo tanto se dedica 100% al negocio. Jesús está casado con su esposo que trabaja como albañil y le ayuda a criar a su hijo. Para las tres mujeres su negocio es importante y sueñan con que crezca y se fortalezca. Por lo tanto, solicitan un crédito a Kiva para poder comprar más cosméticos, ropa y materia prima. De esta manera, podrán ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes y un mejor servicio de modistas. Ellas sueñan con poder tener un local propio para mejorar sus ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida
.
texts.en:
In Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas live three enterprising women who formed the "Mujeres Formales, JC" group.  Santo Domingo is a city with a tropical humid climate and average temperature of 25º C.  The city is known for being a crossroads between several cities on the equator, such as Esmeraldas, Cuenca, and Quito, among others, making it an important Ecuadorian trade center.  Also, Santo Domingo encompasses most of the livestock market of Ecuador.  It is called "de los Tsáchilas" because it is home to the Tsáchilas ethnic group which maintains its traditional dress and customs from before colonial times.

The "Mujeres Formales" group is comprised of Claire, Hortensia, and Jesús.  The three are neighbors and live in the city center.  They set up a business selling cosmetics and clothing, and also offer an alterations service.  Claire, 47, is a single mother and finished her secondary 
education.  Hortensia, 59, has no commitments and so works full time in the business.  Jesús is married and her husband is a bricklayer who helps care for their son.  The business is important for these three women and they dream about expanding and strengthening it.  Therefore, they are requesting a loan from Kiva to buy cosmetics, clothing and raw materials.  This will allow them to offer more products to their customers as well as a better alterations service.  Their goal is to have their own shop so they can increase their income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, clothing and raw materials.

loans.name: Rodolfo Eduardo

texts.es:
Rodolfo, Esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder realizar la compra de ropa nueva para damas, caballeros, y niños, pues considera ser necesaria una nueva inversión para poder fortalecer el negocio comprándose blusas, camisas, pantalones, ropa interior, para diferentes edades, este le ayudará a mantenerse con su clientela es poder continuar trabajando para su familia.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un mejor efecto logrado mejorar el negocio, creciendo en la variedad de prendas de vestir, su situación económica ha mejorado su familia, actualmente se encuentra estable no han incrementado ningún miembro en su familia.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is requesting a new loan to buy women's, men's and children's clothing, because he feels a new investment is necessary to strengthen his business.  He will buy blouses, shirts, pants, and underwear for different age groups, and this will help him maintain customer loyalty so he can continue working for his family.

With the previous loan he was able to penetrate the market better and increase his range of clothing products.  His family economic situation has improved and become stable since the family has not grown.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, pants and underwear.

loans.name: Sonia Cecilia

texts.es:
Sonia vive en una pequeña ciudad al norte de Ecuador conocida como Atuntaqui. A pesar de ser una ciudad de tan solo 21,000 habitantes, es conocida por la industrial textil, la ropa, y la moda. Hay una feria industrial y artesanal los viernes y sábados donde gente de todo el país visita el lugar para comprar ropa de todo tipo de calidad y precios. La ciudad es famosa por los cuys, un plato típico del país. La temperatura promedio es de 18°C. El lugar también atrae turistas para observar monumentos hechos por la antigua tribu de los Atuntaquis. 

Sonia es una mujer emprendedora cuya prioridad es fortalecer el negocio que empezó hace apenas un año. Sonia se dedica a la maquila de pendas de vestir que son muy bien vendidas en su ciudad de origen. A pesar de el corto tiempo que lleva su negocio, el éxito que ha tenido hasta ahora le permite creer que tiene posibilidades de crecer. Por lo tanto, por medio de Fundación Alternativa, solicita un péstamo a Kiva para poder comprar una máquina de coser más moderna, de esta manera podrá hacer un mejor trabajo en su oficio de maquilar ropa y de una manera más rápida.
Con esta inversión ella espera mejorar su calidad de vida y poder cumplir sus sueños a futuro
texts.en:
Sonia lives in a small city in northern Ecuador, known as Atuntaqui. Eventhough there are only 21,000 inhabitants, it is known for its textile, clothing and fashion industries.  On Fridays and Saturdays there is an industrial/artisan fair where people from all over the country come to buy a wide range of different qualities and prices.  The city is famous for its "cuys", a typical dish of this country.  The average temperature is 18º C.  Tourists visit the site to see the monuments made by the old Atuntaquis tribe.

Sonia is an enterprising woman whose priority is to strengthen the business she started about a year ago.  She is a seamstress and works making clothing that has high volume sales in her city.  Despite the short amount of time she has been in business, the success she has had until now leads her to believe there are growth possibilities.  Therefore, through the Fundación Alternativa, she is requesting a Kiva loan to buying a more modern sewing machine, so she can work more efficiently and do a better job.

With this investment she hopes to improve her lifestyle and reach the goals she has for the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy milk.

loans.name: José Héctor

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 62 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Él es empleado en la alcaldía municipal, como encargado de mantenimiento desde hace siete años.

Don José solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para mejorar su vivienda, debido a que con la llegada del invierno a dañado parte del techo y se encuentra en mal estado. De esta manera él y su familia estarán más protegidos y seguros.
texts.en:
José, 62, is married and has four children.  He has worked for the municipal mayor's office as head of maintenance for seven years.

José is requesting a loan through the Fundación Campo to fix up his home because the arrival of winter has damaged part of the roof which is in disrepair.  This will provide protection and safety for him and his family.

loans.use: To fix up his home because the arrival of winter has damaged part of the roof.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married. She has four children all of whom attend school. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has a beauty shop in the center of Samburu in which she works. Saumu began working in this profession with her mother some 10 years ago in her house and, with much effort, and thanks to the savings she had, Saumu managed to prepare herself to become a professional. At present, she has good experience in this profession, which helps her to advance her whole family. 

Saumu comments that she has many clients, female and male. She says all of her efforts are to provide her family with the best, so that in this way, she can have a better lifestyle. With the passage of time and with loans from Yehu Microfinance she went into shoe sales. She comments that she has several customers who always buy shoes from her so she’d like to have more variety available to offer her customers.

She asks for the loan to buy shoes to increase the variety she has on hand in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jesugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier.  La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Aimée, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Aimée a peu fréquenté l’école. Aimée est âgée de 30 ans et est  mariée à un  certain Grégoire. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Aimée vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Il y a environs cinq ans que Aimée mène comme activité, la vente de maïs de façon ambulante.  Aimée s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Aimée sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé avec les autres membres de son groupe. Les deux crédits obtenus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
JESUGNON Group is made up of the persons who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Aimée, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

Aimée, age 30, did not attend school much. She's married to one Grégoire, and the couple has three children to support, who all go to school.

Aimée and her husband live with their children, and make sure together that the various family expenses get covered.

For about five years, Aimée has been selling corn as a traveling saleswoman. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets.

Eager to satisfy her clientele, and in order to increase her revenue, Aimée, together with the other members of her group, is seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. Both previous loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Houetègni

texts.fr: Marié à une marchande du nom de Yénoukounmè et père de deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à sa charge, Houetègni est âgé de 29 ans. Houetègni vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. En plus de ses enfants, Houetègni a un autre enfant à sa charge. Houetègni subvient ensemble avec sa femme aux divers besoins du ménage. Houetègni a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire mais a appris la soudure. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Houetègni fait la soudure dans son atelier depuis cinq ans et cette  activité lui permet de contribuer aux diverses charges de sa famille. Afin de renforcer ses équipements par l’acquisition d’un poste de soudure et d’un étau, Houetègni sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Houetègni, age 29, is married to a merchant named Yénoukounmè. He's the father of two children, who are both in his care. Out of them, one attends school.

Houetègni and his wife live with their children. He has one additional child to support. Houetègni and his wife provide for the various needs of the family together.

Houetègni dropped out of middle school, but got trained as a welder. To provide for his various expenses, he's been welding in his workshop for five years. This business enables him to help with the various expenses of his family.

In order to buy one welding station and one vise so as to improve his equipment, Houetègni is seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster his business and better satisfy his clientele. The first loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy one welding station and one vise

loans.name: Yorodani Group

texts.fr:
Esperance fait partie du groupe Yorodani et habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 40 ans et est mariée à Djuma, un commerçant de poissons. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants, âgés de 4  à 18 ans, dont 4 étudient.
Elle prend soin de 2 enfants, un parmi eux  étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de casseroles, de bassins, de pagnes,…depuis 8 ans.

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de casseroles, de bassins, de  pagnes,  ...à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait combiner le commerce  à l’élevage. En plus,elle voudrait voir ses enfants terminer les études et avoir  un bon avenir.
texts.en:
Esperance, age 40, is a member of Yorodani Group. She lives in Bujumbura and is married to Djuma, a fish merchant. Together they have five children, age 4 to 18. Out of them, four are studying.

For eight years, she's been selling cooking pots, basins, pagnes (colorful African cloth), etc. 

She's seeking her tenth loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will bolster her working capital and buy lots of cooking pots, basins, pagnes, etc, to resell, in order to increase her income.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to combine her business with raising livestock. Furthermore, she would like to see her children complete their studies and enjoy a bright future.

loans.use: to buy lots of cooking pots, basins, pagnes, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
The group leader in this anonymous group is 25 years old. This young Iraqi woman is married and she is a mother of  four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi woman who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has four years experience with the little sewing/tailoring business which she would now like to improve to be able to better serve her customers and provide them with a better variety of services. She took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to purchase an over machine and an embroidery machine. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase an over machine and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
This is Ana. She previously accessed a 24,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ana hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is running a spare parts and lubricant store, in his community in the city of Hato Mayor, an agricultural city surrounded by valleys and mountains. Andres makes his home in a simple structure with his wife and their three children. He has been doing this business for seven years. He told us that he started his business with the first loan he took from Esperanza, with a maximum amount of US$150. He will invest this loan to buy lubricants from different brands.

Andres took his first loan because he wanted to have his own business but he didn't have his own capital. After different loans and investing each one in his business, he has been able to grow his business.  He will use his profits to invest in his business and provide for his family. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Lera

texts.en:
Lera is 36 years old and married with two children.

Lera works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business doing direct selling of Natasha and Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her business.

Lera has borrowed and paid for ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business for five years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Lera aspires to save money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 35 years old, married to Philip, and blessed with three children. For the past two years, she has run a retail shop, a poshomill and dairy farming business, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

With her first loan of KES 80,000 from KADET Ltd., she intends to purchase additional stock for her shop like a sack of rice, two bales of wheat flour and washing detergent as well as animal feed for her cattle.

She intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and diversify the business. Her future plans is to become a large-scale outlet.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop with products such as rice, wheatflour, washing detergents, and to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is from Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three children. 

Riza sells a variety of different products to the local community to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for four years and earns 12,000 PHP a month. 

In 2004, Riza joined GDMPC. Riza is requesting a loan of 38,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. To improve business is what she aims for.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old and married with six children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

Ana needs a loan to expand her plantation by buying chemicals, taro crops, knives, fertilizer etc.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Ana will use the profits from her sales to renovate her house and help with her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy farming tools to grow taro and banana

loans.name: Asiga

texts.en:
Asiga is a 40-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

Asiga has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a knife, crops and other things. 
 
She became a member of SPBD in 2012. With her profits, Asiga want to expand her business and do home improvement.

loans.use: to buy more crops and purchase new working equipment.

loans.name: Tasia

texts.en:
Tasia is 41 years old and married with four children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, yams, and vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

Tasia needs a loan to buy chemicals and equipment like a knife, a rake, a wheelbarrow and other things.
 
She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Tasia will use the profits from her sales to expand her taro plantation and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and equipment for her plantation.

loans.name: Winnie Njoki

texts.en:
Winnie is 50 years old. She is from Ndunyu and is married with four children who are aged between 28 years and 17 years old.  

Winnie has a business selling milk and vegetable crops. She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to buy potatoes, carrots and onions to add to her stock. 

She hopes to get a bigger loan in the future to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy carrots, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is 53 years old and a mother of three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works while two of her remaining three children are continuing their education. Her husband is a daily wage labor and earns a low income every month. Perveen supports her husband by selling baan which is used to make a local kind of seat, called a charpaey. Baan is a thread-like product and is in high demand in the region.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to further improve her business. With the loan investment she will buy baan in larger quantity that will allow her to fulfill the client orders on time and increase her profits.

She has been operating her business for the past many years and is very confident that the loan will be productive one for her.

loans.use: To buy thread (baan) for a thread-selling business.

loans.name: Joyita

texts.en:
Joyita is 56 years old and married with 10 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, soft drinks, chicken boxes and others. She has been doing this for five years. 

Joyita needs a loan to buy good and products for her store. She hopes to use her profits to build her a new house and expand her shop. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy goods and products for the shop.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 43 years old. Alfonsa is married and has three children. 

Alfonsa buys and sells mangos for a living. Alfonsa been in business for five years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2010, Alfonsa joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to obtain more fruit to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to obtain more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Nuufou

texts.en:
Nuufou is 32 years old and married with seven children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Nuufou needs a loan to buy crops, chemicals and equipment for her plantation. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Nuufou will use the profits from her sales to help her children in school and improve her plantation business

loans.use: to buy more crops and purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 35-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Joash and they have six children aged between four and fifteen. She also supports two of her nieces aged ten and eight. Christine operates a catering business in Kisumu, a business she has been doing for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. She will use it to buy a stock of foodstuffs like rice, sugar, maize meal and wheat flour to be used in her catering services. Her profits will be used provide basic needs for the family.

Her dream is to be successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of foodstuffs like rice, sugar, maize meal and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
This is Ana, 49, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roberto and is the mother of their child. Together with her husband she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ana operates a doormat business. Her products are small rugs and doormats. She makes doormats out of excess textile cloth she buys from the factory. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. She directly sells her products to her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ana hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of cloth, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Laasaga

texts.en:
Laasaga is a 43-year-old woman who is married. She needs a loan to buy tyres, oil, a filter and other items to service her taxi. She will use her profits to improve her business and for home improvements. 

Laasaga joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy tyres, oil, and other items to service her taxi.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 49 years old, married to Kipeno, and blessed with two children. She has run a poshomill business for the past three years in Narok area, earning a monthly income of KES 35,000. 

She has applied for her fifth loan of KES 70,000 from KADET Ltd., which she intends to use to purchase additional cereals for her poshomill.

She intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and grow the business. Her future plans is to become a large-scale outlet

loans.use: to buy more cereals for her poshomill business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is from Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Nancy is married and has nine children. To make a living, Nancy owns and operates a business making and selling food. Nancy has been in her business for 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Nancy joined GDMPC. Nancy is requesting a loan of 5,900 PHP, which will be used to buy kitchen utensils used in preparing food. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils used in preparing food.

loans.name: Penisila

texts.en:
Penilsila is a 64-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yam and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

Penisila has requested a loan to buy equipment like a rake, a knife, chemicals and other things.
 
She became a member of SPBD in 2012. With her profits, Penisila hopes to expand her business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more crops and purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 44 years old, married to Rose, and blessed with four children. For the past six years, he has run a handcart transport business in Narok town, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has applied for his third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET Ltd. He intends to purchase additional handcart, and employ someone else to run it. The area has a water problem thus his services are in high demand.

He intends to use the profits gained to start a small shop. His future plans is to create employment for more youths in the community.

loans.use: to buy a new handcart for his transport business

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en:
Ulata is 39 years old and a widow with four children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams so she can sell them in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 10 years. Ulata needs a loan to buy chemicals, crops, fertilizer, and equipment.

She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Ulata will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation.

loans.use: to buy more crops and purchase new working equipment.

loans.name: Tagiilima

texts.en:
Tagiilima is 58 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, soft drink, flours, sugar, chicken, sausage etc. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

Tagiilima needs a loan to re-stock her shop. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and keep her children in school. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy goods and products for the shop.

loans.name: Wend Tongo De Zongo Group

texts.fr:
Mr YEMFINSI est le représentant du groupe WEND TONGO DE ZONGO. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. Un va à l’école et il a 03 personnes en charge.
Mr vend des céréales (Maïs, petit mil, haricot) depuis 08ans. Il s’approvisionne à Boromo, Bobo et villages périphériques.  Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes. 
Il veut s’acheter 07 sacs de maïs et 02 sacs de mil.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut améliorer son activité. Il ambitionne créer autres sources de revenus et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yemfinsi is the representative of the WEND TONGO DE ZONGO group.  He is married and the father of two children, ages 7 and 2.  One of his children attends school, and Yemfinsi has three people in his care.

Yemfinsi has been selling cereals (maize, pearl millet, beans) for the past 8 years.  He buys his goods in Boromo, Bobo, and the surrounding villages.  His clients are men and women.

He wants to buy 7 bags of maize and 2 bags of millet.

With his profits, he would like to improve his business.  His ambition is to find other sources of income and to ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 7 bags of maize and 2 bags of millet.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa  is 54 years-old and married with children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or in the market. She has been doing this for 10 years. Epenesa  needs a loan to buy chemicals, knife, rakes, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Epenesa will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy farming tools to grow taro and bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy airtime in bulk, candy, wine and liquor to sell.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 51 years old. She lives in Kharagauli district, West Georgia with her husband, Mikheil, and three children (15, 18 and 19 years old). 

According to government estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they get monthly social assistance. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They have a milking cow, one calf, one pig, and two bulls. They also own a plot of land where nuts are grown. They sell nuts in Zestafoni market. The total average monthly income of the family is 300 lari.

Tamar requested a loan for repairing the staircase in the house. She wants to create a clean and comfortable environment for the family. She hopes that the improvement of their living conditions will positively impact their business activities as well.

loans.use: to repair the staircase in her house.

loans.name: Siolo

texts.en: Siolo is a 39 year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Siolo  has requested a loan to to buy more crops and purchase new equipment. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Siolo hopes to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more crops and purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for livestock business.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy  is 29 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling fresh fish in her community and has been doing this for three years.
