Judy  has requested a loan to buy fishing net, fishing hooks, a knife, etc. for her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Judy  will plan to expand her business and renovate her house and also to help her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, hooks, a knife, etc

loans.name: Iutita

texts.en:
Iutita is a 30-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Iutita  has requested a loan to buy a rake, a knife, chemicals, fertilizer, etc. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Iutita  hopes to expand her plantation and do some home improvement.

loans.use: to buy farming tools to grow taro and bananas

loans.name: Uzima Group

texts.fr:
Chantal fait partie du groupe Uzima et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 48 ans et est mariée à Ibrahim, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont  8 enfants, âgés de  7 à 28 ans, dont 4 étudient.
Elle prend soin de 3 enfants  qui étudient; ce sont les membres de sa famille élargie.

Elle fait le commerce de restaurant, des habits, des chaussures, de l'huile de beauté, des moustiquaires, des sacs  à main, depuis 12 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de produits vivriers (haricots, riz, huile de palme,…) pour son restaurant, de l’huile de beauté, de moustiquaires, de chaussures, à revendre  pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait   construire une maison sur sa parcelle et  voir ses enfants continuer les études.
texts.en:
Chantal is a member of the Uzima group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 48 years old and married to Ibraham, a driver. Together they have 8 children aged between 7 and 28, four of whom are in school.

She has three children in her care who attend school; these are the members of her extended family.

She has been running a restaurant and selling clothes, shoes, body oil, mosquito nets and handbags for 12 years.

She is seeking her third loan from the micro-finance institution Turame. She is going to use the loan obtained from KIVA to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of food crops (beans, rice, palm oil, etc) for her restaurant as well as body oil, mosquito nets and shoes for resale so that she can earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to build a house on her plot of land and see her children continue their studies.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy a large quantity of food crops (beans, rice, palm oil, etc) for her restaurant as well as body oil, mosquito nets and shoes for resale so that she can earn more.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Emmy is a widow aged 25 years old. She is blessed with three children. She manages a tea plantation and has been running the business for six years earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.  She has borrowed her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD that she intends to use to pay labor for tea plucking as well as to purchase fertilizers for the farm. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children.  Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: pay for labor for tea plucking and also buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is 18 years old and married with no children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, and vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Ruta needs a loan to buy chemicals, a rake, a knife, and other equipment for the plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Ruta will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and to rebuild her house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, knife, rake, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina  is 23 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Sina  has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, Koolaid, oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sina will expand her pancake business in town and the income will help her to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients for production of pancakes: flour, sugar, yeast, etc

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan  is a single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 12 years to 27 years. She describes herself to be a faithful woman. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as sugar, salt, flour, etc . She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be sometimes little bargaining power from customers. 

Susan will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more daily use items for resell. Her business goal is to buy permanent  business premises  within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more daily use items such as flour, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Agbadjinanfa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AGBADJINANFA est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et font ensemble la tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Mariama est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Mariama est âgée de 32 ans, et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Yaya. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Mariama n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Il y a deux ans, Mariama vend des glacières et des assiettes de façon ambulante ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Mariama achète ses produits dans sa région. C’est la première fois que Mariama et les autres membres du groupe AGBADJINANFA sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The AGBADJINANFA group consists of three women who are friends and who belong to the same tontine savings group. The leader of the group is called Mariama. She is raising her hand in the photo. Mariama is 32 years old and is married to a driver called Yaya. The couple has two children who are both in their care. One of their children attends school. Mariama did not go to school. The children live together with their parents. Mariama has been working as a street trader selling coolers and plates for two years. This activity enables her to cover the various family expenses together with her husband. Mariama buys her products in her region. This is the first time that Mariama and the other members of the AGBADJINANFA group are requesting a loan from the microfinance institution ALIDé. This loan will enable them to strengthen their businesses in order to better respond to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy coolers and plates

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui cohabitent et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Wassiatou. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Wassiatou  a peu fréquenté l’école. Wassiatou est âgée 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Djamal. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Wassiatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer un mieux être à ses enfants, Wassiatou vend des piles, des lampes et des torches de façon ambulante. Wassiatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Wassiatou et son groupe MAHOUGNON sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Wassiatou et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité par l’augmentation du stock de leurs produits et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le premier crédit à été bien remboursé
texts.en:
MAHOUGNON is a group made up of three women who live together.  They are requesting a loan from ALIDé in order to increase their working capital.  The group's leader (raising her hand in the photo) is named Wassiatou.

Wassiatou only attended school for a short period of time.  She is 31 years old and married to a man named Djamal.  They have four children, all in school and their dependents.  Wassiatou lives with her husband and children and takes care of the household expenses with her husband.

In order to improve her children's well-being, she sells batteries, lamps and flashlights, as an itinerant seller.  She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.

It is the second time that Wassiatou and her group are requesting a loan from ALIDé.  This loan will certainly help her and her group to increase their stock of merchandise, and therefore to boost the level of their activity.  Thanks to this loan, the group's members will also increase their customer base and their income.

Their first loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy batteries, lamps and flashlights.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilzer, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Alba Nelis

texts.es:
Alba, Esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo pues necesita invertir en el negocio comprandose los materiales que son necesarias para la elaboración de papas fritas y pupusas, por ejemplo se comprará maíz, papas, aceite, condimentos, quesillo, entre otros materiales que son necesarios para que pueda continuar en la producción de su negocio.

Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo en el fortalecimiento del negocio, conprandose materiales para la panadería, esto le ha ocasionado un incremento en la rentabilidad de sus negocios, ya que ha ganado mayor clientela, en su familia ha tenido algunos inconvenientes ya que  su hija han enfermado y esto le ha ocasionado gastos médicos.
texts.en:
Alba is asking for a nre loan because she needs to invest in her business. She will be buying the materials she needs to make french fries and pupusas. For example, she will buy corn, potatoes, oil, condiments, cheese and more materials needed to keep up production at her business.

She states that the previous loan helped her fortify her business. She bought materials for the bread bakery. This has resulted in an increase in profitability in her businesses, since she has gained more customers. There have been some problems in her family, since her daughter fell ill and this has resulted in medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn, potatoes, condiments and cheese.

loans.name: Nicolasa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Nicolasa, Esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio, conprandose maíz, leña, gas, que son los materiales necesarios para mantener su producción de tortillas y atender bien a su clientela, estos préstamos le permiten contar con los recursos económicos y poder invertir en los materiales necesarios.

El efecto que tuvo con un préstamo anterior fue crecer y tener a la mano todo lo necesario para poder realizar su trabajo y atender clientes, su situación familiar está cambiando el que tiene mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is asking for a new loan to be abel to invest in her business. She will buy corn, firewood and natural gas. These are the materials she needs to maintain production of tortillas and serve her customers well. These loans allow her to have financial resources and be able to invest in the necessary materials.

The effect the previous loan had was to help her grow and have everything she needs on hand to do her job and serve her customers. Her family situation is changing with the higher income.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and natural gas.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita, tiene 38 años,es casada, tiene 3 hijos, reside en el Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.  Doña Margarita se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de productos de la canasta básica y abarrotería como ser: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, maseca, carne de pollo, medicinas y productos de limpieza. Inicio su actividad de venta de alimentos en pequeña escala, al transcurrir el tiempo, ha invertido las ganancias obtenidas para ver un crecimiento en su negocio. Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la suma de 20,000 Lempiras, los cuales destinará a surtir más la pulpería y así cubrir la demanda alimenticia de sus clientes. Ella espera obtener una mejoría en sus ingresos y para eso destina todo el día de trabajo continuo.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita, age 38, is married and has three children. She resides in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.

For the past six years, Doña Margarita has been selling basic household products and groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, lard, cornmeal, chicken, medicines, and cleaning products. She started out selling food on a small scale, but as time passed, she invested her earnings in the growth of her business.

Margarita is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL to restock her store and meet the food demands of her customers. She hopes to see an improvement in her earnings, so for this reason, she continues to work every day.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: FIFA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Florence Ablawa (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans. Florence Ablawa a peu fréquenté l’école. Florence Ablawa est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, et vivant à sa charge. Florence Ablawa vit avec ses enfants et assure les charges de la maison. Depuis quinze ans, Florence Ablawa mène comme activité la vente des sachets à son domicile. Florence Ablawa s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité, Florence Ablawa sollicite un crédit ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFA. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Fifa is a group of 3 people, whose members all live in the same district. The group's representative, Florence Ablawa (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 40 years old. She did not get much schooling. She is a widow and mother of 3 dependent children, who all attend school. She lives with her children and takes care all of the household expenses and responsibilities.

Florence Ablawa has been selling small plastics bags from her home for 15 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In order to raise the level of their business activity, Florence Ablawa is requesting a loan together with the other Fifa members. This loan will enable them to strengthen their businesses and better respond to their customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy small plastic bags.

loans.name: Railkhon

texts.ru: Раилахон  проживает в селе Уч – Коргон на юге Кыргызстана со своей семьей. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности, Раилахон с мужем откармливают скот и занимаются садоводством, начав этот бизнес еще 30 лет назад. На сегодняшний день, хозяйство Раилахон позволяет получать около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Раилахон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и  перепродажи, которые в целях экономии средств на корм будут отправлены на летнее пастбище.    Доходы Раилахон планирует вложить в постройку сарая.
texts.en: Railkhon lives with her family in the village of Uch-korgon in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Like many families in rural areas, Railkhon and her husband raise livestock and grow garden produce, having launched this business some 30 years ago. At present, Railkhon’s farm allows her to earn about 10,000 KGS per month. In order to develop her business further, Railkhon turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,00 KGS  to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. In order to save on the cost of feed, the sheep will be sent to  a summer pasture. Railkhon plans to use her revenues for building a shed.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Enagnon 3 Group

texts.fr: ENAGNON 3 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. Le représentant du groupe, Moudjibou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 53 ans et n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Moudjibou est marié à une marchande du nom de Raïmi. Le couple a trois enfants dont deux sont leurs propres enfants et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la famille. Moudjibou a appris la couture, activité qu’elle exerce depuis dix neuf ans et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Parallèlement à cette activité principale, Moudjibou vend des fils de couture et des tissus. Moudjibou s’approvisiionne dans une ville du Bénin et dans sa région. La clientèle de Moudjibou s’agrandit de plus en plus. Afin d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle ainsi d’assurer les multiples besoins de sa famille, Moudjibou sollicite pour une première fois, ensemble avec  les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON 3, l’appui financier de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à rehausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The group ENAGNON 3 is made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same savings' group.  

Moudjibou (raising his hand in the photo), is the group's representative.  He is 53 years old and never went to school.  He is married to a seller named Raïmi.  Moudjibou and Raïmi have three children, two of whom are their own children.  All three children are their dependents.  The couple live with their children and jointly ensure that the family needs are met.

Moudjibou has learned sewing, an activity he has been involved in for the past nineteen years, and which brings him a rather good income.  In addition to this main activity, he also sells sewing threads and fabrics.

He buys his supplies in a town in Benin and in his region, and has an increasing number of customers.  

In order to raise the level of his activity and to meet his customers' demand and his family's various needs, Moudjibou is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé for the first time, together with the other members of the ENAGNON 3 group.  This loan will certainly help them to boost the level of their activity and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy sewing threads and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sedjro Group

texts.fr: SEDJRO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Henriette (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée 43 ans. Henriette a très peu fréquenté l’école. Henriette est mariée à un certain du nom de Benoit. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Henriette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Depuis une dizaine d’années environs, Henriette vend divers produits (conserves, sucre, lait) dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Henriette vend de la nourriture (pâtes de maïs, riz accompagnés de sauce). Henriette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Henriette s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe SEDJRO pour consentir un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Sedjro is a group composed of 3 people who all live in the same area. The group's representative, Henriette (who has her hand raised in the picture), is 43 years old. Henriette has hardly any schooling. She is married to Benoit and the couple have 4 dependent children, who all go to school. Henriette lives together with her husband and children and the couple both take care of the household expenses and responsibilities.

Henriette has been selling various products (canned goods, sugar, milk) in her district for around a decade. She also sells prepared food (corn pasta, rice and sauce). She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With a view to strengthening her business and satisfying customer demand, Henriette is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé in association with the other members of the Sedjro group. The first 2 loans received by the group have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments, corn and rice.

loans.name: Leonor Yanet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de celulares y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de artesanias como polos,ceramicas,mantas,aretes y collares,la socia vende celulares desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de celulares y negocio de venta de artesanias.La socia solicita el credito para comprar celulares y tambien para comprar artesanias como aretes,mantas,ceramicas y collares.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Los Solidarios” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She has a business of selling mobile phones, but she also has another business in which she sells handcrafted items such as pullover shirts, ceramics, blankets, earrings, and necklaces. The member sells mobile phones from 8am to 7pm. Through this business, she is able to help her child move forward. Her dream is to expand both her mobile phone business and her handicraft business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy mobile phones, as well as handicrafts such as earrings, blankets, ceramics, and necklaces.

The member is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, as well as handicrafts such as earrings, blankets, ceramics, and necklaces.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
This is Minerva. She previously took out a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to make repairs and upgrades to the cars that she buys. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts for some of the cars that she sells. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her business and personal needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

Minerva dreams to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for upgrades and repairs to the cars that she sells

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La  représentante du groupe, du nom de Edith est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Edith a eu fréquenté l’école. Edith est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Rufin. Le couple à deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Edith vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Edith vend des sachets, des chaussures et des assiettes par le système de distribution depuis près de sept ans. Edith s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Edith sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Fifonsi group is made up of 3 people who all live in the same district. This is the second time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to raise their business levels. The group's representative, Edith, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. Edith hardly has any schooling. She is 34 years old and married to Rufin. The couple have 2 dependent children who both attend school. Edith lives together with her husband and children and the couple both take care of the household expenses.

In order to be able to meet her responsibilities, Edith has been selling small plastic bags, shoes and plates via the distribution system for nearly 7 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the quest to satisfy her customers and increase her sales numbers and revenues, Edith is requesting, together with the other members of Fifonsi, a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan received by the group was properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Mariela De Los Angeles

texts.es: Mariela de los Angeles de 27 años de edad, obrero con un hijo de tres años, esta solicitando el financiamiento para realizar mejoras en su vivienda las cuales consiten en levantar la paredes de mi casa  que recien adquiri mi solor el cual con mucho sacrificio logre comprar , espero y tengo fe que con los financiamiento que el programa kiva y leon 2000 me brinden porde terminar de contruir mi casa, el financiamiento lo necesita para comprar material de construccion como: bloques, cemento, cal, arena, piedrin, madera, alfajillas, clavos, pintura, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mariela de los Angeles is a 27-year-old worker who has a child who is three years of age. She is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to her home, which include erecting the walls of her house. She recently acquired a plot of land through great sacrifice.

Mariela has faith that the loan provided through the Kiva program and Fundación León 2000 will provide her with what she needs to finish the construction of her house. The loan that she needs will be used to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, lime, sand, gravel, wood, rafters, nails, paint, and other items.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, lime, sand, gravel, wood, rafters, nails, paint, and other items.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario. She previously accessed a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that she used to buy fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy more products for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rosario hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, and other items.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a Kiva borrower. She has six children. She describes herself as an honest woman. She operates a farm where she sells maize and beans she harvests from the farm. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that sometimes crops that were sowed fail to sprout. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy more seeds for planting. Her business goal is to buy some land within five years. She hopes that in the future, she can build a house with profits generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy seeds for sowing.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 37 years old, married to Catherine, and they have two school-going children. He has a livestock trading business and has been in operation for three years, earning a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

He has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET Ltd. He will use the loan to purchase more cattle for resale. He plans to use the profits gained to run his livestock business and for the upkeep of his family. 

His hopes and dreams are that his livestock trading business prospers; he also hopes to venture into the green tea selling business.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, She previously accessed a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Erlinda hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of providing all her children with a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jectone

texts.en: Jectone used his previous loan to buy cables, metal bars and bulbs. His business improved since he serviced the loan. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested another loan of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy a drilling machine.

loans.use: to buy a drilling machine

loans.name: Neiba Mariana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Neiba, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada pero aun no ha podido tener hijos. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga como buena esposa que es para ayudar a su esposo y con esto contribuir con los gastos del hogar,  realiza el crédito para que el invierta en su negocio, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, nos cuenta ella que su esposo  tiene un puesto en el Mercado de Manta, allí el trabaja todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta las 16h00 y lleva más de 8 años con este negocio,  ella por su parte en su casa también tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la cual se gana algo extra por su cuenta.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y víveres para surtir la tienda. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentado su negocio que aun e muy pequeño.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the lowlands of Montecristi, a city that is known for a large diversity of traditional products such as the Panama hats that are famous both within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Neiba. She is 38 years old, married, but has no children. Her husband is a merchant.

Neiba is a good wife who helps her husband by contributing to the household expenses. She is taking out a loan so that she can invest in his business of selling fruits and legumes. Neiba says that her husband has a stand at a market in Manta where he works every day from 5am to 4pm. He has been in this business for more than eight years. Neiba also manages a small grocery store from her home so that she can earn some extra money of her own.

This loan will be used to buy fruits, legumes, and groceries to restock her store. She has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning. Neiba is the group treasurer and she enjoys being a member because one of the loans was used to start her business. Her dream is to continue growing her business, which is still very small.

loans.use: to buy fruits, legumes, and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To paint, and build a floor in her house.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 55 years old, married and with two children. She does dairy farming for a living. She is hardworking in her business and has been operating it for five years. She does her farming in a conducive environment and has reliable customers. She dreams of buying more cows in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a cow and expand her cow shed.

loans.use: to buy a cow and expand her cow shed.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 64 years old and single with four adult children, ages 30 to 45 years. She has run a clothing selling business for two years and earns KES 15,000 monthly. 

This is her second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan. She will use the loan to purchase shirts, sweaters, jackets and dresses for resale. 

She plans to reinvest anticipated profits back into business. Her dream is to manage her business well and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dresses, shirts, sweaters and jackets for resale..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more maize, beans, and dry peas for resale.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is 29 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living, she sells eggs. She has been engaged in the business for two years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in business management skills. This has helped her to improve her business. She has also learnt how to save her money. 

Evalyne hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy eggs for resale.

loans.use: To buy eggs for resale

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan previously took out a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business finances.
 
She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more recyclable materials. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her business and personal needs. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Joan hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She also hopes that her children will all finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por un nuevo prestamo para seguir incrementando el negocio e invertir en la compra de maíz, azúcar, papel de empaque, y otros materiales para continuar en la venta de atoles y pan, estos préstamos le han permitido a Rosa poderse superar y mantener la disponibilidad económica para realizar periódicamente sus inversiones.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo, ya que sus ventas han continuado permanentes, se mantiene en su negocio, ha logrado cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia y por el momento no han tenido ningún inconveniente.
texts.en:
Rosa has decided to get a new loan to continue growing her business and invest in the purchase of corn, sugar, packaging paper, and other materials to keep on selling atol (a warm drink made of corn) and bread. Those loans have allowed her to be able to get ahead and maintain financial liquidity in order to regularly make her payments. 

She got a positive result from her previous loan since her sales have continued, she’s kept her business, she’s been able to afford her family’s basic need, and right now they haven’t had any problems.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, and packaging paper.

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en: Stanley has been selling animal feed to make a living for four years. He had previously requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya which helped him to buy animal feed for his business. He has also improved on his savings because of the training he received in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He needs a loan of 110,000 KES to buy more animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: John

texts.en: John runs a butcher shop to earn a living. He had previously acquired a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya which helped him to buy meat for resale. He has also improved on his saving skills because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy a knife and refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy a knife and a refrigerator

loans.name: Enagnons Group

texts.fr: ENAGNONS est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Marguerite. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Marguerite est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un certain Jean-Baptiste. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur  charge. Marguerite vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Marguerite a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Marguerite vend du maïs, des charbons de bois et divers produits à son domicile depuis près de huit ans. Marguerite s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à  Marguerite et aux membres de son groupe ENAGNONS de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Enagnons is a group of 3 people who live in the same district and whose leader is Marguerite (the one with her hand raised in the picture). In order to increase their working capital, the group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the 4th time.

Marguerite is 28 years old and married to Jean-Baptiste. The couple have 4 dependent children who all go to school. Marguerite lives with her husband and children and she and her husband both take care of the household responsibilities. Marguerite left school at primary level. In order to satisfy her needs and those of her family, Marguerite has been selling corn, charcoal and other products from her home for nearly 8 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. 

This loan will definitely enable Marguerite and the other members of the Enagnons group to raise the level of their business activity and to increase their customer base and revenue. Their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and various other products.

loans.name: Jonny  Antonio

texts.es:
Jonny es originario de Teustepe-Boaco, casado, de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, padre de dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad que  están a su cargo, actualmente  estudian su primaria en una escuela de la comunidad. El inicio su actividad desde muy joven ayudandole a sus padres en  las tierras, donde fue adquiriendo experiencia y dominio en el negocio, luego se casa,  decide independizarse empieza a trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos porque vio  la necesidad  de generar ingresos para la familia, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposa que le ayuda a vender sus productos en la misma comunidad, en temporada de verano Jonny viaja fuera del país para trabajar y obtener otros ingresos, le gustaría que sus productos fueran comercializados en otros lugares donde paguen a un mejor precio.

Su expectativa es seguir trabajando en su negocio aunque su única dificultad es que en algunas cosechas no le va muy bien lo que genera perdidas para la familia pero eso no le impide mantener su negocio activo ya que es algo que le gusta hacer y con lo que ha podido salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para comprar abono, insumo, fertilizantes, etc, toda la materia prima que se necesita para darle mantenimiento a sus tierras para la cosecha, el estima que este crédito será de ayuda ya que podrá obtener mayor producción y una mejor calidad en sus productos para vender a un mejor precio, sus planes futuros es comprar 5 manzana de tierras para seguir sembrando con el objetivo de obtener mayores ingresos para la familia y poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jonny is originally from Teustepe-Boaco. He’s married and works as a farmer growing basic grains. He’s the father of two children who are 6 and 3 years old and in his care. Right now they are in a local primary school. 

He began his business when he was young helping his parents in the fields where he got experience and took over the business. Later he got married and decided to go out on his own. He began to work farming basic grains because he saw the need to make money for his family. His wife helps him in the business; she sells their products in their neighborhood. In the summer Jonny leaves the country to work and get more income. He would like to sell his products in other places where they can get a better price. 

His plan is to continue working in his business although his one problem is that some harvests don’t go very well and then generate a loss for the family. But that won’t stop him from keeping his business open since it’s something that he enjoys and with it he’ll be able to get ahead. 

He’s asking for a loan to buy manure, supplies, fertilizer, etc—all of the basic materials that he needs to maintain his fields for the harvest. He estimates that that loan will be helpful since he’ll be able to get a larger crop and better quality product to sell at a higher price. His plans for the future are to buy five apple fields to continue planting with the goal of getting a better income for his family and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy manure, supplies, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Ramon Mauricio

texts.es:
Ramón, está solicitando un préstamo para poder continuar en el fortalecimiento de su negocio, con este comprara forraje a su ganado y algunos insumos para sembrar el maicillo, pues esto le permitirá continuar dándole alimento a su ganado y el maicillo también le servirá para alimento.

El préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo del cual obtuvo maíz, siendo una cosecha abundante, en el aspecto económico reconsidera sus condiciones no han cambiado mucho, ya que hace dos meses le robaron dos vacas, que significaban parte de su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Ramón is requesting a loan to be able to continue strengthening his business.  He will use the loan to buy fodder for his livestock and some supplies to plant sorghum.  This will allow him to continue feeding his livestock, and the sorghum will also serve as feed.

The previous loan had a positive effect with which he got corn.  Corn is an abundant crop.   Going over his finances, his conditions have not changes much.  That is because two months ago two of his cows were stolen.  They were part of his assets.

loans.use: to buy fodder and supplies for his sorghum crop.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 33 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in Prenza, Tangub City, Philippines, and owns and operates a farm where she plants and harvests corn. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by selling her crop, and earns about PHP 7,000 a month. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,300 to buy fertilizer for her farm. Arlyn joined GDMPC in 2010 and hopes to make improvements to her home and upgrade her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old and married, with two children. He operates a retail shop for a living. He has been in the business for five years and has one employee. 

He previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped him to grow his business. He has also been able to manage his business because he has been trained in business management. He needs a loan of KES 80,000 to buy cups and plates for resale.

He dreams of operating a wholesale business in five years and buying a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy cups and plates for resale.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is 48 years old and lives in Cortes, Bohol. She is married with four children, ages 16, 19, 22 and 24. Her husband is a farmer, but his earnings are not enough for their family's needs. 

Mauricia helps by raising chickens in her chicken coop. She has been in this business for seven years now. She is asking for a loan to buy feed for her chicken and pay for school fees of her children. 

In the future, Mauricia hopes that she will be able to improve her business profits and develop other business opportunities, so she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for chicken and pay for school fees.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is 25 years old. He is a jua kali (hot sun) artisan who makes water cans, feeders and gutters to earn a living. He has been in the business since the year 2006 and has one employee. He describes his immediate business environment to be busy with readily available customers. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of opening another outlet in a different location and establish a company for his business in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy iron sheets.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets

loans.name: Vene

texts.en:
Vene is 43 years old, married to David and has 4 children. Their children are between 14 and 22 years old. Vene runs a tailoring business and has been in operation for 4 years. The business brings in a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

She has applied for her second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her first loan. She’ll use the loan to purchase sewing materials and another sewing machine. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hope and dream is that her business does well and, God willing, she’ll open a tailoring school.

loans.use: To purchase textile materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Alosogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOSOGBE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un certain Frédéric. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Jeanne vend depuis près de quinze ans de l’igname et des beignets frits à son domicile. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin.  Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jeanne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOSOGBE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Alosogbe group has three members living in the same neighborhood. This is the third time that the group is requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to expand their business. The group’s representative, by the name of Jeanne, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Jeanne is 52 years old and married to a man named Frédéric. They have four dependent children, all in school. Jeanne lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various household needs. In order to make a living, for 15 years Jeanne has been selling yams and fritters out of her home. She stocks up in a region of Benin. In the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her revenue, Jeanne, together with the other members of the Alosogbe group, is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy yams and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Ayimevo Group

texts.fr: AYIMEVO est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Lucresse Akouavi Sylviane. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Lucresse Akouavi Sylviane est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à un certain Angelo. Le couple a un enfant à leur charge. Lucresse Akouavi Sylviane a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Lucresse Akouavi Sylviane vend des friperies de façon ambulante depuis près de quatre ans. Lucresse Akouavi Sylviane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Lucresse Akouavi Sylviane sollicite un premier prêt ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIMEVO. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Ayimevo is a group of 3 people who live in the same area and whose leader is called Lucresse Akouavi Sylviane (the woman with her hand raised in the picture). The group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time, in order to increase their working capital.

Lucresse Akouavi Sylviane is 25 years old and married to a man called Angelo. The couple have one dependent child. Lucresse Akouavi Sylviane left school at secondary level. In order to satisfy her needs and those of her family, Lucresse Akouavi Sylviane has been selling second hand clothing on the street for nearly 4 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

In order to become more competitive on the market, Lucresse Akouavi Sylviane and the other members of the Ayimevo group are requesting a first loan together. This loan will enable them to raise the level of their business activity and to increase their customer base and their revenue.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing.

loans.name: Esmilda

texts.es:
Esmilda forma parte del Banco Comunal “Caminando Juntos” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro de restaurante donde ofrece todo tipo de tragos y comidas, y siempre cuenta con mucha clientela por la buena atención que ofrece. Se desempeña  desde hace 35 años en sus labores de restaurante trabajando desde su casa con la ayuda de una amiga, de lunes a viernes y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad ya que se encuentra delicada de salud.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y proveedores de licores para abastecer su restaurant.
Con el crédito comprará cervezas, bebidas, botellas de vino, coñac, menta, masas y productos alimenticios.
Una de las metas de Esmilda en su negocio es poder ampliar una  habitación para la fabricación de sus ricas empanadas y que su clientela vea como es el proceso de elaboración de sus empanadas.
Esmilda vive junto a su amiga que es el brazo derecho en su negocio. Sus sueños a nivel personal es volver a escribir sus libros que los dejo por problemas de dinero, se dedica a escribir cuentos, poesías, narraciones, y a nivel laboral seguir creciendo en su restaurante para poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Esmilda se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras el grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. 
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles
texts.en:
Esmilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Caminando Juntos” (Walking Together) which is located in the city of Rancagua.  She works in the restaurant field where she offers all types of drinks and foods.  Her restaurant is always has many customers as a result of the good service she offers.  She began working in this restaurant 35 years ago when she established it at her home with the help of a friend.  Her work schedule is from Monday to Friday depending on her availability since she is in delicate health.  

Esmilda buys her inventory from distributors and liquor sellers so that she can stock her restaurant.  With this loan, she will buy beer, beverages, bottles of wine, cognac, crème de menthe, pastries, and food products.  One of Esmilda’s goals for her business is to expand her home so that she can produce her delicious empanadas.  Her customers will also be able to see how the empanadas are made.  

Esmilda lives with her friend who serves as the right arm of her business.  Her dreams on a personal level include returning to writing books once her financial problems are behind her.  She wants to write tales, poems, and stories while still continuing to grow her restaurant so that she provide jobs to other people.  

Esmilda is very pleased and appreciative of the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza so that she can invest in her business.  In addition, she feels very comfortable to be in the company of other entrepreneurs in her Communal Bank group with whom she shares different activities and interests.  Their meetings also provide her with a moment of distraction.  

Rancagua is part of the Libertador Bernardo O’Higgins region. This modern city is one of the main producers and exporters of fruits and wine in Chile. It is also a mining city because it is the home of “El Teniente”, one of the largest underground mines in the world with 4500km of tunnels.

loans.use: to buy beer, beverages, bottles of wine, cognac, crème de menthe, pastries, and food products.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 51 años, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre. Está separada del padre de sus hijos. Actualmente vive en compañía de su anciana madre y su hijo Joel de 28 años. La casa donde viven la heredó de su padre.
Su actividad es la venta de abarrotes y comestibles, para lo cual abrió una bodega en su vivienda, ya que la necesidad económica era fuerte y la pensión o apoyo económico de su ex pareja no le alcanzaba. Decidió iniciar este negocio hace más de 6 años, tiempo que le valió para lograr crecer y ampliarlo. Le gusta su actividad, pues le permite socializar con sus vecinos y así tener más amistades y poder platicar de temas de su interés, además de sentirse ocupada y una persona productiva, y gracias a los ingresos económicos puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Por otro lado, no le gusta que algunos de sus clientes se demoren en el pago de los créditos que les otorga, considerando la posibilidad de ya no brindar crédito, para así poder tener más efectivo en sus manos e invertir en ampliar su negocio.

Este es su préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP y se siente contenta de poder contar con el apoyo y avanzar en su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además, de sentirse cómoda con su grupo de su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros, para surtir y aumentar el disponible de mercadería en su bodega.
texts.en:
Natividad is 51 years old. She’s a hardworking and joyful woman. She’s separated from the father of her children. Right now she lives with her elderly mother and her son, Joel, who’s 28 years old. She inherited the house where they live from her father.

She sells groceries and foodstuffs. To do that she opened a store in her home since she really needed the money and the payments and economic support from her ex-partner wasn’t enough. She decided to start this business more than 6 years ago, and in time she’s been able to grow and expand. She likes her work since it allows her to socialize with her neighbors, have more friendships, talk about things that interest her, and feel like a busy and productive person. Thanks to the income, she’s been able to afford the household costs. On the other hand, she doesn’t like that some of her clients are late in repaying the credit she’s extended them, so that she can have more cash on hand and invest in the growth of her business. 

This will be her 11th loan with MFP and she’s happy to get the help and advance her business. For that reason she promises to be punctual in the repayment of her loan. Also, she’s comfortable with the communal bank group since she considers the members to be responsible and team-minded. 

With the amount of 1500 nuevos soles that she’s requested, she’ll invest in the purchase of groceries and foodstuffs like rice, sugar, noodles, etc. to expand the supply of merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, etc.) to stock her store.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is a woman who likes to work very hard.  She is very kind and persistent. Some years ago she went to Russia to find a job. She worked there for years, but didn't like it.  She returned to her town and decided to organize own business. Gulchehra studied a course called "To get success in business," and now she has some skills for organizing business dealings. 

Nowadays she is going to organize her own business selling dried fruits as "kuraga". She is a divorcee who is bringing up four daughters alone. Gulchehra has very difficult life. Please, help her to organize her business and improve her living.

loans.use: To buy goods for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon lives in Montol, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. For 5 years he has earned through providing transportation services so as to support the needs of his 4 children. He gets an income of 3,000 PHP a month from this business. For a 29-year-old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy except to see his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Marlon borrows an amount of 5,700 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair his transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children a better education. He joined GDMPC in 2010. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair his transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a 31-year-old business lady in Kikambala, Kilifi. She runs a video entertainment business in Kilifi town and has been in the business for 10 years. Her business has been doing well and she has been able to entertain her clients, most of whom are the Kilifi youths.

This marks her first business loan from KADET LTD and she plans to refurbish the video premise by repairing the seats and walls of the premise. She also plans to start a juice business that will mainly target her clients. 

She hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand her business and hopes to have a more profitable business in future.

loans.use: to refurbish the video premise by repairing the seats and walls of the premise

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is 40 years old, married and the father of three children. For the last 14 years, he has earned a living by repairing vehicles. His business is doing well and now has four employees and many customers. Since becoming a client of Faulu Kenya, he has started to save because he has learned about financial management. He hopes to expand his business in the future, employ more people and buy a piece of land. He is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for an auto repair shop.

loans.name: Athman

texts.en: Athman is 29 years old, single, and has earned a living for the past year by raising poultry for sale. He lives in the town of Kilifi and has been successful in this line of work. He was recently introduced to KADET LTD and is requesting his first loan, which he will use to buy buy more chicks to raise and sell later at a profit. He will use the additional profit made possible by this loan to expand his business and achieve his goal of having a happy, prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mahukpego 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO 3 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yabo est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Yabo est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Yabo est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Laurent. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et seulement un reste à leur charge. Yabo vit seule avec son enfant et assure ensemble avec son mari, ses divers besoins et ceux de son enfant. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Yabo mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d'années, la vente des produits cosmétiques (parfums, poudre) dans sa région. Yabo s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Yabo sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO 3, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mahukpego group is made up of 3 people who are friends and live in the same neighbourhood. This is the 3rd time that this group is requesting financial help from ALIDé, so that they can raise the level of their business activity.

The group's representative, called Yabo, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. Yabo is 37 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a driver called Laurent. The couple have 5 children, some of whom are educated, and only one of whom is still dependent on them. Yabo lives alone with her child and she and her husband both take care of her needs and those of their child. In order to be able to provide for herself, Yabo has been selling beauty products (perfumes and powders) in her region for around 20 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction as well as increased sales and revenue, Yabo is requesting, together with the other members of the Mahukpego group, a 3rd loan from ALIDé. The first 2 loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy perfumes.

loans.name: Wangninan 20 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAN 20 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et dont deux appartiennent à une même famille. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Denise Dossignon est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Denise Dossignon est âgée de 49 ans et vit au Bénin. Denise Dossignon n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Denise Dossignon est mariée à un certain Blaise. Le couple n’a que deux enfants à leur charge dont aucun scolarisé et aucun n’est leur propre enfant. Denise Dossignon vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec  son mari les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Denise Dossignon vend depuis cinq ans, des assiettes et des chaussures par le système de distribution. Parallèlement à cette activité, Denise Dossignon vend des jus de bissapes. Denise Dossignon s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Denise Dossignon sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAN 20, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra certainement à hausser le niveau de leurs activités et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
WANGNINAN 20 is a group of three friends, two of whom are related. This is the group’s first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. The group’s representative is Denise Dossignon, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Denise Dossignon is 49 years old and she lives in Benin. She never went to school. She is married to a man named Blaise, and they have two dependent children in their care. The children are not their own, and they do not attend school. Denise Dossignon lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Denise Dossignon has been selling plates and footwear for five years through the distribution system. As a secondary activity, she also sells bissap juice (hibiscus). She buys her merchandise locally and in city of Benin.

To achieve customer satisfaction, and to increase her sales and revenue, Denise Dossignon is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group WANGNINAN 20. This credit will help them to bolster their activities and their profits.

loans.use: to buy plates and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is 33 years old, married and earns a living by selling food from her stall in Miritini, Mombasa. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and is requesting her second loan, which she will use to buy a variety of food stuffs as well as new chairs, tables and serving dishes. She will use the profits she expects to earn to repay her loan and expand her business. Her goal for the future is to excel in her current line of work.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food stuffs and new chairs, tables and serving dishes.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en: Maimuna is 32 years old, married and has earned a living for the last four years by selling charcoal to the residents of Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She supplements her income by selling coconuts. She is doing very well and is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income she earns to improve her coconut business. Her goal for the future is to make her businesses more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides

loans.name: Damaris Del Pilar

texts.es:
Damaris, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo pues necesita invertir más en la tienda, conprándose gaseosas, productos no perecederos como arroz y cafe, azúcar, productos enlatados sardinas, atun, también otros materiales que sean necesarios para sus clientes, pues entre más disponibilidad tenga de productos así será la demanda que podrá recibir de sus clientes.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar sus ventas, ya que ofreció mayor variedad de productos a los clientes, esto ha mejorado su situación económica para ella y para su familia.
texts.en:
Damaris has decided on a new loan because she needs to invest more in the store.  She will buy soft drinks and non-perishable products like rice, coffee, sugar, canned goods, sardines, and tuna.  She will also buy other materials that her customers need.  The more availability of products that she has, the more demand there will be from her customers.

The effect  the previous loan had was to improve her sales.  This is because she offered a greater variety of products to her customers.  This has improved her financial situation and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque,  considera ser necesaria una nueva inversión es un negocio en la venta de frutas y verduras, manifiesta que tiene dos personas dependientes quienes le ayuda a vender en el negocio de manera ambulante, se comprara tomates, cebollas,  papas, plátanos, manzanas, bananos, repollos, entre otra variedad de productos que existen en el mercado.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, que le ayudó a mejorar el negocio, ya que se dedicaba a la venta de atol, y hoy en día está dedicada a la venta de fruta y de verdura este rubro le ha generado mejores ingresos por eso considera mejor mantenerse en este tipo de negocio, cuenta con un local en el mercado donde puede expandirse más con sus productos y a futuro para mejorar.
texts.en:
Carolina is requesting a new loan because she thinks further investment in her fruits and vegetables business in needed given that she has two street vendors who help her.  She will buy tomatoes, onions,  potatoes, plantains, apples, bananas, cabbages, and other market products.

Her prior loan truly helped her improve her business. Previously, she was selling cornflour drinks, and now she sells fruits and vegetables, which generates more income. She thinks it is better to continue this business and has a stand in the market where she can offer more products and improve her future prospects.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions,  potatoes, plantains, apples, bananas, and cabbages.

loans.name: Nigor

texts.ru:
Нигор родилась 1948 году в Вахдате. Она вдова. У нее один ребенок. 
Нигора окончила Университет Предпринимательства и Сервиса. Она работала почти во всех сферах бизнеса. 
Нигора на сегодняшний день занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает национальные платья. 
Торговлей Нигора занимается пятнадцать лет. Она берет кредит на сумму 2300 долларов США для покупки тканей и платьев.
texts.en: Nigora was born in 1948 in Vahdat.  She is a widow and has one child.  Nigora graduated from the Entrepreneurship and Service University.  She has worked in almost all business areas.  Today, Nigora is involved in sales at a market.  She sells national dresses.  Nigora has been in sales for fifteen years.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $2300 to purchase fabrics and dresses.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and dresses

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru:
Исмоил родился 1969 году. Он проживает в городе Вахдат. Живет вместе с женой. У него пятеро детей. 
Исмоил по специальности водитель. Он предоставляет услугу такси. Исмоил развозит пассажиров по маршруту Душанбе - Вахдат и по городу Вахдат. Исмоил имеет богатый опыт в этой области. 
Он берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля с целю предоставления безопасной услуги. Также Исмоил хочет провести капитальный ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Ismoil was born in 1969.  He lives in the city of Vahdat together with his wife.  They have five children.  Ismoil is a driver.  He provides a taxi service.  Ismoil transports passengers along the Dushanbe-Vahdat route and within the city of Vahdat.  Ismoil has a rich experience in this area.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car in order to provide a safe service.  Ismoil also wants to make major repairs in his house.

loans.use: to repair his car and house

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
This is Estelita, She previously accessed an 9,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Estelita dreams to expand and grow her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 48 years old.  She owns a food stall in Kiembeni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of six children. She has been selling food for the past ten years.

This marks her first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes.

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and also in the expansion of her business. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат- молодая женщина, у неё дети и она воспитывает их без мужа, так как по семейным обстоятельствам она развелась.Она фармацевт по профессии и работает в двух аптеках по графику.Знает своё дело очень хорошо и имеет большой стаж.Хотя она получает зарплату в двух местах, она не может накопить деньги на крупную  покупку.Её дочь уже выросла и она хочет купить ей ювелирные изделия на приданное.Уже надо  покупать приданное,потому что она скоро планирует  выдать дочь замуж.Она рада, что узнала о нашей организации и обратилась к нам за финансовой поддержкой.
texts.en: Mamlakat is a young woman.  She has children, whom she is raising without a husband because she got divorced due to family circumstances.  She is a pharmacist and works at two pharmacies according to a schedule.  She knows her business very well and has a lot of experience in it.  Despite the fact that she earns a salary in two places, she cannot save money for a major purchase.  Her daughter is already grown, and Mamlakat wants to buy her jewelry for a dowry.  She needs to buy the dowry because she plans to marry off her daughter soon.  Mamlakat is happy to have learned about our organization and to request financial assistance from us.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru:
Фаридун проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 22 года. Он живет вместе с женой. Фаридун недавно окончил университет, он программист. Фаридун еще не устроился на работу по профессии. Он решил поработать таксистом. В студенческие годы Фаридун подрабатывал, предоставляя услугу такси.
Фаридун берет кредит для приобретения нового автомобиля и в дальнейшем хочет установить в машине оборудование для природного газа.
texts.en: Faridun lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 22 years old.  He lives together with his wife.  Faridun recently graduated from a university as a programmer, but he has yet to find work in his field.  So he decided to work as a taxi driver.  During his student years, Faridun worked part-time, providing a taxi service.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a new car and wants to install a natural gas conversion in the car in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud has had his business for more than 15 years. He sells men's shoes. His skills help him to develop the business. Mahmud brings goods from China. He has a wide assortment and many customers. He has a lovely wife and 3 children.  Mahmud’s son helps him with the business. Mahmud wants to open a new selling place in the local market. He has many friends and sometimes meets with them after the work day.  He wants to develop the business, but no one can help him.  He is asking for a loan to buy goods and open a new selling place. He waits your help and support.

loans.use: To purchase a new assortment of shoes

loans.name: Somoeurn's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Sangke district of Battambang Province, Somoeurn is 44 years old and married. She has 8 children, three of whom mainly depend on her as they are still at school. For the family's basic needs, she has been working on three hectares of farmland for growing corn and cassava. From her current business, she is able to earn about 21,000 Cambodia Riel (KHR). She has used the past three loans successfully. She paid back all the loans, which have helped her to sustain her big family. She joins this cycle with another member. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion, KHR 300,000, to buy fertilizer for her cash-crop. She believes that her business will gradually improve so that she can earn more income for keeping her children until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash-crop

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y  empeñosa. Su pareja es Neliño, el padre de su hijo. Vive en compañía de sus padres, su pareja, su hijo y su hermano, en la casa de sus padres.
Su actividad es la venta de comida rápida como salchipapa (salchicha y papas fritas), pollo broaster, salchipollo, entre otros. Lo cual realiza en el frontis de su vivienda, donde instala su carrito freidor, todas las noches, teniendo como sus clientes a los transeúntes de la zona, vecinos y amistades.  Se inició en esta actividad  hace más de un año y actualmente le ayuda su cuñada en la atención a los clientes. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus platillos, logrando acabar todo lo que prepara. Esto le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual solventar los gastos de su hogar, pues ha tenido muchas necesidades económicas por los bajos ingresos. Pero ahora se siente más aliviada por tener un oficio y sentirse una persona productiva. Por eso tiene planes y desea mejorar el espacio donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. 

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que espera pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse muy bien con su banco comunal, pues lo considera ser un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de víveres e ingredientes para la preparación sus comidas; como papas, aceite, harina, carne de pollo y otros. También  realizará algunas mejoras en el frontis de su casa instalando un techo provisional, mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
