loans.use: To buy truck parts to start his sister's business

loans.name: Dushiko

texts.en:
Dushiko is 49 years old. He lives in a small village of Vani District with his wife Khatuna and their three children (9, 13 and 17 years old). All three, study in the village school. Dushiko is a Director in his village school and Khatuna is a teacher. They receive monthly salaries. In addition to their activities, they are busy with the family agricultural business. They have 2 milking cows and 2 calves. Khatuna milks cows twice a day and produces cheese. They have a pig and sell piglets in nearby villages. In addition to their livestock, they are busy with farming. They own a plot of land, where nuts is grown, and a vineyard. In the fall, they pick grapes and produce wine. Dushiko and Khatuna sell the produced cheese, wine and nuts on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Lari.  They work hard but still don’t have enough income to put away some savings for purchasing additional needed household goods or for renovation of the house.

Dushiko plans to open a grocery store in his village. He requested a loan for the store. He has his own building so he will need to repair it and will purchase refrigerators and other necessary equipment for the store. After the store is equipped, he will purchase inventory. There is no similar store in the neighborhood and Dushiko hopes that he will attract customers and will have good sales. Thus, Dushiko will start a new business in order to increase the income of the family. With the increased income, they plan to renovate the house and purchase household techniques. As a result, Dushiko and Khatuna will be able to create better living conditions for their three children. They hope for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to open a grocery store

loans.name: Saoudatou

texts.fr: Epouse d’un revendeur et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 à l’école, Madame Saoudatou est âgée de 32ans. En 2008, elle a démarré son activité de vente de friperie. Activité qu’elle exerce dans un marché de la place avec sa fille ainée. Son approvisionnement se fait au même lieu et elle sollicite ce premier prêt de WAGES pour renforcer sa vente d’habits de friperies. Elle veut faire développer son activité et assurer le bien – être de la famille.
texts.en: The wife of a retailer and a mother of four children in school, Ms. Saoudatou is 32 years old. In 2008, she started her business selling secondhand clothing. With her oldest daughter, she operates it at a local market. Her supplies are gotten from the same place, and she is requesting this initial WAGES loan to bolster her sales of used clothing. She wants to develop her business and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Nandinsoyol-Erdene

texts.en: Nandinsoyol-Erdene is 34 years old and lives with her husband, Oyunbaatar, and two children in a ger in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her daughter goes to secondary school and her two-year-old son stays at home. She started her organic dairy production business in 2009 with 5 dairy cows. She sells the organic milk to local residents. Her business seems to be sustainable because she has gained a number of regular customers. She is a good-natured woman, who says "I want to buy two more cows to improve the breeding and increase the production volume." She needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase good breeding cows.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 48 years old. He lives in a small village of Abasha District with his family: his wife Eka, his 5-year-old daughter and his parents, who are pensioners. His wife is a refugee and receives assistance from the local government. 

The family is busy with their agricultural business. In particular, they work with livestock. They have six milking cows and two piglets. David and Eka produce cheese, part of which is used by the family with the rest sold at the local open market. The family's total average monthly income is 550 Lari.

David requested a loan for purchasing milking cows; he wants to expand his dairy farm. With more cows he will be able to increase production and cheese sales. This will positively impact the family income. Increased income will be reinvested in the family agricultural business to expand and become more profitable, which will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Sansarmaa

texts.en: Sansarmaa is 31 years old and lives with her husband and son in the Suhbaatar district, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband works for a private company and the son goes to kindergarden. She used to work as a teacher at the 58th secondary school. Currently, she is conducting a training center for pre-school aged children, and the monthly income is around 735,000 MNT. She has obtained loans ranging from 1,500,000-3,000,000 MNT and has been paying her debt on time. Her business is expected to be improved in the future. She is a good-hearted woman and says "I wish that all children be well-educated and enlightened." She is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a hybrid car to carry children to the training center.

loans.use: To purchase a hybrid car to carry children to the training center

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Revendeuse de cartes de recharges depuis 2008 de façon ambulante, Madame Adjo est âgée de 26ans et a 01 enfant en charge. Elle est à son premier crédit de WAGES et ce montant qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle désire élargir son activité en ayant une boutique. Avec le profit  réalisé, elle veut pouvoir assurer l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: Mrs. Adjo is a street vendor selling prepaid cell phone cards. She is 26 years old and has one child in her care. She is on her first loan with WAGES. This loan will allow her to stock up in order to better meet customer demand. She would like to expand her business and open a store some day. THanks to her revenues, she would like to be able to provide for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy prepaid cell phone cards.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is a hardworking man. He is taking out a loan of Ksh 20,000 to start another business. With this current loan, he plans to purchase timber for resale. 

Kazunga lives in Kaloleni with his family. His business goal is to expand his businesses and open more businesses, while his personal goal is to see his children educated.

Kazungu is so grateful to both Kiva and Yehu for the support given. Thanks for the previous loan that improved his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marilyn used her last loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Now, she is facing a need again in her agricultural business where she cultivates fruits. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Abesalom

texts.en:
Abesalom is 65 year old; he lives in a small village of Samtredia District with his family, wife Izolda, son, daughter-in-law and 3-year-old granddaughter. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They have one milking cow and produce approximately 20kg. of cheese monthly. They also have a plot of land, where tomato, greens, and nuts are grown. They work hard on their plot to get a good harvest. They sell the harvested products on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 400 Lari. which is hardly enough even for food for 5 members of the family. 

Abesalom requested a loan to expand his agricultural business. He will purchase construction materials for the greenhouse. He plans to expand and renovate it. When the greenhouse is ready, the family will sow more vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage and greens) throughout the entire year. This will increase the sales and monthly income of the family. With the increased income, they will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. As a result, living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to expand and renovate the greenhouse

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en: Annastasia is 28 years old. She is married, with two children, a two-year-old son who is in school, and a seven-month-old daughter. Her business is selling clothes in a small shop and she has done this for three years. She began this business out of the necessity to have a source of employment in order to have a profitable livelihood to support her children. Now, Annastasia aspires to accomplish her dreams and personal goals, such as finishing the construction of her home and opening a boutique. The financing that she is applying for will be invested in the purchase of bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been operating a poultry business. She is 34 years old, married to a carpenter, and has been blessed with four children.

Margaret is a business-oriented woman, who dreams of making bigger profits in order to establish a new business which will help her in improving their financial stability. She has had this business for almost two years and it has allowed her to help her husband to satisfy their basic needs and save for the education of her four children.

In order to attain her goal, she is requesting additional working capital of Ksh 20,000 which will be used to buy feeds and chicks. She believes that her faith and dedication in running her business will make it possible for her to achieve success in life. Despite the good progress, she tells us that her major challenge is disease outbreak.

loans.use: to buy feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Madame Yawa est veuve. Elle a 02 enfants qui sont âgées de 37 et 35ans. Depuis 2006, pour subvenir aux dépenses de la famille, elle vend plats jetables, des papiers torchons et des sandalettes dans un marché de la place. Sa difficulté est la concurrence croissante sur le terrain. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et ce prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle veut renforcer son activité et assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Yawa is a widow. She has two children who are 37 and 35 years old. She has been selling disposable plates, paper towels, and sandals at the local market since 2006 in order to meet her family's needs. Her main difficulty is competition within the market. She is on her second loan with WAGES which allows her to purchase merchandise. She would like to strengthen the business and ensure the self-sufficiency of her family's dietary needs.

loans.use: to purchase disposable plates, rags and toilet paper.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Agée de 44ans et mère d’01 enfant âgé de 12ans qui est scolarisé, Madame Abra est une femme dynamique qui se bat chaque fois pour joindre les deux bouts afin de prendre soin de sa famille. Depuis 2009, elle a commencé par vendre des produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et la difficulté qu’elle rencontre est le ralentissement dans les achats.  Elle est à son premier crédit de WAGES et cela lui servira à s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle veut avec les profits supplémentaires acheter des cartes de recharges et des produits d’alimentation générale. A l’avenir, elle veut devenir grossiste et voir son enfant s’épanouir.
texts.en: A 44-year-old mother of one 12-year-old child who attends school, Ms. Abra is a dynamic woman who struggles every time to make ends meet in order to take care of her family. Since 2009, she has been selling general food products at a shop. She gets her supplies in Lomé and the difficulty she faces is the slowing down of purchases. She is on her first loan from WAGES and this will serve to obtain supplies of her merchandise. With her supplemental profits, she wants to buy rechargeable phone cards and general food items. In the future, she wants to become a wholesaler and see her child flourish.

loans.use: To buy general food products.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Madame yawa est mère d’01 enfant âgé de 09ans qui va à l’école. Son mari est magasinier dans une société de la place. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et maitrise bien son domaine. En plus de sa coiffure, elle vend des mèches pour bien répondre aux besoins de ses nombreux clients. C’est depuis 2002 qu’elle exerce l’activité et elle s’y plait bien. Une personne l’aide. Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, devenir grossiste et participer à l’éducation de son fils.
texts.en: Ms. Yawa is the mother of one child, who is 9 and attends school. Her husband is a stock controller at a local company. She is a hairstylist by profession and has mastered this activity. In addition to styling hair, she sells hair extensions to respond well to the needs of her numerous customers. She has run this business since 2002 and enjoys it. One person helps her. She is seeking this second loan to buy hair extensions. She wants to reinvest in her business, become a wholesaler, and participate in her son's education.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Afin de mieux réaliser des bénéfices et participer à l’éducation des enfants, Madame Abla sollicite de WAGES un troisième prêt pour s’approvisionner en condiments et produits d’alimentation générale (activité qu’elle exerce depuis 1999). Elle le fait dans une boutique et s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé et dans les villes voisines de la ville. Notons qu’elle est mariée à un revendeur et ils ont eu ensemble 02 enfants qui sont tous sur le banc d’école. Ils sont âgés de 09 et 07ans. Madame Abla est une jeune dame âgée de 36ans. Elle veut dans l’avenir, devenir grossiste et faire vendre les produits à l’étranger.
texts.en: In order to realize larger profits and participate in her children's education, Ms. Abla is seeking a third loan from WAGES to supply herself with condiments and general food products (this is a business she has run since 1999). She runs her business at a shop and gets her supplies generally in Lomé and in the neighbouring cities. She is married to a retailer and together they have two children who are both attending school. They are aged 9 and 7. Ms. Abla is a young woman aged 36. In the future, she wants to become a wholesaler and sell products abroad.

loans.use: To buy condiments and general food items.

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 36ans et mariée à un professeur, madame Kafui est mère de famille. Elle est ouvrière dans une société et en plus de cette activité elle vend depuis 2007 des pagnes, des chaussures à ses collègues au service et à domicile. Par moment, elle vend du maïs. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des pagnes, des chaussures et du mais. Elle voudrait augmenter son stock afin de satisfaire ses nombreux clients. Son souhait à l’avenir est d’avoir sa propre boutique et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: A young lady aged 36 and married to a teacher, Ms. Kafui is the mother of a family. She works at a company and has also been selling pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and shoes to her coworkers and at home since 2007. At times, she also sells maize. She is on her second loan from WAGES and is seeking this loan to buy pagnes, shoes, and maize. She would like to increase her stock in order to satisfy her numerous customers. Her hope in the future is to have her own shop and to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy shoes, pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing), and maize.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a very industrious lady who is always on the look out for business opportunities. In search of a source of income for her family, she started a new business of selling firewood and charcoal. Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Amina was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of Ksh 10,000. She buys her merchandise from the rural areas and then sells them at retail. Today, her merchandise selection is limited and this is why Amina requested another loan in the amount of Ksh 50,000 from the "Yehu and Partners" company to purchase stock of firewood and charcoal, and pay school fees for her form four son. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of firewood and charcoal, and pay school fees for her form four son.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Mr Kokou est père de famille. Agé de 37ans, il est marié à une revendeuse de pagnes et ont un enfant de 09 mois. Pour jouer son rôle de père de famille, il a commencé il y a 04ans par vendre les produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique.  Il y a de cela quelques temps qu’il effectue des opérations financières avec notre institution et vient auprès d’elle pour avoir un fonds pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux gérer ses clients. Une personne l’aide dans l’exécution de ses taches. Il veut dans l’avenir quitter le stade de détaillants pour le stade de grossiste et subvenir aux besoins de la famille sur tous les plans.
texts.en: Mr. Kokou is a family man. He is 37 years old and married to a woman who sells fabrics. They have one child who is 9 months old. In order to be a good provider for his family, he started selling general food items from a small shop 4 years ago. Some time ago he started working with our institution and requested a loan so he could buy more merchandise to better serve his clients. He has one employee who works with him. He would like to move his business from retail to wholesale in the future and meet all his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase basic food items.

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants, (06 et 02ans) dont 01 scolarisé, Madame Aline est mariée à un commerçant. En 1999, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. 01 personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité et elle le fait dans une boutique.  Elle manque de fonds c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce troisième crédit de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Les deux derniers crédits ont été payés sans problème et pense honorer de son engagement pour solder à temps ce crédit qu’elle sollicite. Elle veut augmenter son stock et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille sur tous les plans.
texts.en: A mother of two children (aged 6 and 2) of whom one is in school, Ms. Aline is married to a shopkeeper. In 1999, she began earning income by selling general food products. One person helps her with her business, which she runs in a store. She is short on funds, and this is why she is seeking her third loan from WAGES to supply herself with merchandise. The two previous loans were repaid without problems, and she intends to honour her commitment and settle the current loan she is seeking in time. She wants to increase her stock and ensure her family flourishes on all fronts.

loans.use: To buy general food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for education at the Maharishi Institute

loans.name: Agbessinon

texts.fr: Marié à une couturière, Mr Agbessinon est âgé de 31ans. Il a 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé. Ils ont 05 et 03ans. Il est médecin de profession et a un cabinet médical dans lequel il soigne les patients. Cette activité à été démarré par Mr  Agbessinon en 2006 et il s’y plait énormément car il porte assistance à ceux qui sont dans le besoin. Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite lui servira à acheter des produits génériques. Il voudrait dans l’avenir augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et améliorer ses prestations de services. Il veut pouvoir financer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr. Agbessinon is 31 years old and married to a tailor. He has two children aged 5 and 3 with one in school. He is a trainer doctor and has a small practice where his takes care of patients. Mr  Agbessinon started the business in 2006 and he enjoys it greatly because he can help others in need. His is requesting his second loan to purchase some general items for the business. He would like to increase his sales and improve the services to his patients. He would like to be able to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase general items.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.fr: Mr Solomon est marié à une revendeuse. Il a en 2011, loué une boutique pour exercer comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de pièces détachées à deux roues. Il exerce seul l’activité et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des pièces détachées. Il veut réinvestir dans son activité, devenir grossiste et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Mr. Solomon is married to a retailer. In 2011, he began renting a shop to start his business of selling spare parts for 2-wheel drive vehicles. He works alone and is requesting his first loan to buy spare parts for resale. He wants to reinvest in the business, become a wholesaler and meets his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy working tools for an auto mechanic

loans.name: Dziffa

texts.fr: Madame Dzifa est une jeune dame de 32ans. Elle mère de 02enfants dont 01 scolarisés. Ils ont 14 et 04ans. Elle est employée dans une société de la place. Soucieuse de l’avenir de ses enfants et pour pouvoir  joindre les deux bouts, elle a ajouté la vente de pagnes depuis 2010. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et exerce l’activité à domicile. Ce premier prêt lui servira à s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille. Elle veut renforcer son activité et assurer l’éducation et la santé des enfants. La difficulté qu’elle rencontre est le retard dans le paiement.
texts.en: Mrs. Dzifa is a 32 years old. She has two children who are 14 and 4 years old, the older is in school. She is employed by a local company, but out of conern for her children's future and to make ends meet, she also started selling fabric since 2010. She buys her merchandise in Lome and sells from her home. This first loan will help her to buy inventory and to better meet her family's needs. She would like to strengthen the business and ensure the education and well-being of her children. Her biggest challenge is the delay in being paid.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 38 years old and is married with three children, aged between 5 and 16 years old, and she takes care of five children. She purchases and sells various goods such as cooking oil, rice, salt, small fish, and beans. She has been in this business for three years, and she currently employs two people to help her.
Epiphanie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as cooking oil, rice, salt, small fish, and beans for resale. With any profits, she will be able to buy a cow, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as cooking oil, rice, salt, small fish, and beans for resale

loans.name: Wyclyne

texts.en:
Wycklyne is twenty nine years old and married. She has four children. Wycklyne operates a fish business. She has been in this business for two years, earning a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use it for purchasing more stock of fish. She plans to use the anticipated profit to plough back in business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living standards and to be a distributor of fish to hotels in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a person who has had to go through many adversities in her life. However, she’s always had the strength to get ahead and continue making progress with her children. 

Chinyavu is a married mother with 8 children. She has operated a vegetable stall for the last three years. Now that Chinyavu has taken up the business, she needs a loan to buy fruits and vegetables to meet customers' demands so that she can continue generating better income for her home leading to improved quality of life for her children and better opportunities for economic progress. 

Chinyavu aspires to expand the business and open more businesses in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kauli

texts.en:
Kauli is a kiosk operator of 42. He is married, a father of six children, and lives in Mwambalazi. He has been selling miscellaneous products (both food items and non-food items) for four years.
Kauli is requesting a loan of KSH 50,000 to strengthen his working capital and develop his business by purchasing more merchandise. This will make him more profits which will mean he can pay fees for his children and look after his family. 
Kauli is keen to grow his business and would like, one day, to become a wholesaler. This will allow him to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 27 years old and is married. He has one child who is 3 years old. Emmauel sells various goods such as: lotions, soap, radio etc. He has nine years of experience in this work and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, in order to buy various goods such as: lotions, soap, radio etc. for resale. With any profits, he will be able to buy a motorcycle and he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as: lotions, soap, radio etc., for resale.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 50 years old and is married. He has six children aged between six and 20 years old. Celestin sells drinks and food like: fanta, juice, bananas, rice, beans etc. He has six years of experience in this work and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Celestin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his pub by buying more drinks and food like: fanta, juice, bananas, rice, beans etc for resale. With any profits, he will be able to buy two cows and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to expand his pub by buying more drinks and food like: fanta, juice, bananas, rice, beans etc for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Kadiatu from Moriba town in the southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 years and 25 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 1995, Kadiatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she has been into business throughout her lifetime; she does not go to school, and business is the only thing she can understand better. She works at the business 10 hours a day and 6 days per week. She describes her major problem as poor road network and difficulty in getting the used clothes and bags.
Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more used clothes and bags. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and buy a television. In the future, Kadiatu plans to educate her children up to university. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes and bags

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Marie from Moriba town in the southern area in Bo. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 10 years and 22 years. Three of her children attend school. 
Marie runs a food stand business around her neighborhood. She sells Maggi, rice, oil, pepper, wood, garden eggs, and tomatoes. She has been running this business for 25 years. She works at the business from 7:30am until 8:00pm, 7 days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that her business is doing well.
Marie has requested a loan in order to buy more Maggi, rice, oil, pepper, and wood. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family welfare and educate her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more Maggi, rice, oil, pepper, and wood

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée à un enseignant  et mère de 02 enfants âgés de 16 et 12ans tous à l’école, Madame Afi est une jeune dame de 31ans qui ne baisse les bras pour rendre sa famille heureuse. C’est pour cela depuis 2009, elle a décidé de vendre des poissons. Elle exerce l’activité dans un marché de la place et s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé. Ce second prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter des  marchandises (poissons). Avec les profits supplémentaires, elle veut  acheter plus de poissons, renforcer l’activité et aider les enfants à mieux réussir leurs vies.
texts.en:
Married to a teacher and the mother of two children, ages 16 and 12 who both attend school,  Afi is a young 31-year-old woman who spares no effort to make her family happy.

For this reason, she decided in 2009 to start selling fish.  She works at a local market and usually stocks up in Lomé.

This second loan requested by her will allow her to buy some merchandise (fish).

With additional profits, she wants to buy more fish, strengthen her business, and help her children to better succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbons de bois et des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2005, Madame Ablavi est mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisés. Ils ont entre 18 et 08ans. Son conjoint est transitaire.  Son activité se déroule à domicile et 01personne l’aide dans l’exercice de ses taches. En cette période de vacances elle voudrait stocker des marchandises pour mieux vendre c’est pour cela, elle fait appel à WAGES pour lui octroyer un montant. Elle est à son troisième prêt de crédit. Elle voudrait réinvestir dans l’activité, acheter un terrain et construire une habitation.
texts.en:
Ablavi has been reselling charcoal and general food products since 2005.  She is the mother of three children, ages 8 to 18, who all go to school. Her husband is a forwarding agent.  

Ablavi works at home and carries out her tasks with the help of one person.  During this vacation period, she would like to store some merchandise in order to increase her sales, and this is why she has turned to WAGES to request a loan.

This is her third loan.

She would like to reinvest in her business, buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and general food products.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, aider son mari mécanicien dans les charges du ménage, Madame Adjo s’est lancée dans le commerce de balaies et divers. C’est en 2004 qu’elle s’est donnée dans cette activité et elle s’y plait énormément car cela lui procure des revenus qui lui permet de s’épanouir et d’assurer les moindres besoins de la famille. Notons qu’elle a 07 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Ils ont entre 32 et 14ans. Son activité se déroule à domicile. Elle fait confiance à WAGES depuis un moment et est à son neuvième crédit de WAGES. C’est pour cela elle  sollicite encore de nous un autre montant qui lui servira de s’approvisionner en marchandises.
texts.en:
In order to provide for her family and help her husband, a mechanic, cover the household expenses, Mrs. Adjo started a business in 2004 selling brooms and other items. She likes it a lot, because it provides her with an income which enables her to blossom and meet her family's every need.

She has seven children, out of which two attend school. Their ages range from 14 to 32. She runs her business at her home. She's been trusting Kiva's partner, WAGES, for a while, and she's seeking her ninth loan from them, to be used to resupply her stock of products.

loans.use: to buy brooms and other items

loans.name: Intumwa Group

texts.fr:
Pascaline fait partie du groupe Intumwa et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 27 ans et est mariée à Justin, agent de la Brasserie et limonaderie du Burundi(Brarudi) . Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de  2 mois à6 ans, dont  2 étudient.
Elle prend soin de sa petite sœur qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce d’habits depuis 5ans. 
Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait   ouvrir un magasin d’habillement, voir ses enfants étudier et terminer les études.
texts.en:
Pascaline is a member of Intumwa Group and lives in Bujumbura. She's 27 years old and married to Justin, an agent with Brarudi (a brewery and soft drink company in Burundi).

They have three children together, aged two months to six years. Out of them, two go to school. Pascaline also takes care of her little sister who is studying.

She's been selling clothes for five years and she's seeking her fifth loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will bolster her working capital and buy lots of clothes to resell, in order to increase her income.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to open a clothing store, and see her children begin and completed their studies.

loans.use: to buy lots of clothes to resell

loans.name: Les Soeurs Unies Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATOUMA représente le groupe LES SŒURS UNIS. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 04 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.


Elle vend du bois de chauffe depuis 06ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les provinces avec les camions. Ses clients  sont les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 03 ranges de bois.

Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir  son champ d’activité.
texts.en:
Fatouma represents the Les Soeurs Unis group. She is married and mother to five children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old and the youngest two. Four of the children go to school and Fatouma has five dependents.

She has been selling firewood for the past six years and gets her supplies with lorries in the provinces. Her customers are women.

She would like to buy three packs of wood. She wants to save her profits so that she can expand her business and her ambition is to widen her area of business.

loans.use: to buy three packs of wood.

loans.name: Hezagirwa Group

texts.fr:
Audace fait partie du groupe  Hezagirwa et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de 25 ans. 

Il  fait le commerce de véhicule, offre le service de transport par taxi, il a aussi une boutique(haricot,riz,sucre,...)  depuis  4 ans. 

Il est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique(haricot,riz,sucre,...), à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait construire des maisons à faire  louer.
texts.en:
Audace is a member of the Hezagirwa group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 25 years old and single. He has a car business, offers a taxi transport service and has also run a shop selling products like beans, rice and sugar, for 4 years. This is his 7th loan from Turame. 

The Kiva-sponsored loan he receives will increase his capital and allow him to buy a lot of products (beans, rice, sugar, etc.) to resell in his shop so that he can earn more money. In the coming years, he would like to build some houses to rent out.

loans.use: many products (e.g. beans, rice, sugar) for resale in his shop.

loans.name: Turwize Group

texts.fr:
Paulette fait partie du groupe Turwize  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 51 ans et est mariée à Louis, vendeur de la bière locale. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 12 à 20 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, sel,…)  depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son  neuvième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique(haricot, riz, sel,…)  , à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Le gain de son commerce lui permet de nourrir ses enfants ,  acheter les habits et assurer les soins de santé de la famille
texts.en:
Paulette is a member of the Turwize group and lives in Gitega. She is 51 years old and married to Louis, a salesman of local beer. The couple have 5 children together, aged between 12 and 20.

Paulette has run a shop selling items like beans, rice and salt, for 10 years. This is her 9th loan with Turame. The Kiva-sponsored credit that she will receive will increase her capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of stock (beans, rice, salt, etc.) for resale in her shop, so that she can earn more. The profits from her business allow her to feed her children, buy clothes and provide for the family's health care needs.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of items (e.g. beans, rice, salt) for resale in her shop.

loans.name: Mahugnon As Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHUGNON AS est composé de quinze personnes qui vivent dans un même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Annick est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Annick n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Annick est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de François. Annick est mère de deux enfants dont un scolarisé et les deux à la charge du couple. Annick vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Annick mène comme activité depuis quinze ans, la vente de nourriture accompagné de sauce faite à base des condiments dans un quartier du Bénin. Annick s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Annick sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement MAHUGNON AS, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The "Mahugnon As" group is made up of 15 people who live in the same area. This is the 4th time that the group is requesting financial help from ALIDé, in order to raise their level of business activity.

The group's representative, Annick, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. Annick did not go to school. She is 40 years old and married to a cook called François. Annick is the mother of 2 children, one of whom goes to school and both of whom are dependent on the couple. Annick lives together with her husband and children. The couple both take care of the various household responsibilities.

In order to be able to meet her responsibilities, Annick has been selling food and sauces made from condiments in a district of Benin for 15 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, increased sales numbers and revenues, Annick is requesting, together with the other members of "Mahugnon As", a 4th loan from ALIDé. The first 3 loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sandals, sport shoes, flip-flops, flats, platform sandals and children's shoes, among others.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jaquelin de 45 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad y tiene una fritanguera donde prepara deditos de queso, papas rellenas de carne, verdura, pollo  arepas y patacones, su negocio lo inició hace 10 años, con $50.000 COP,  necesidades familiares que superar y muchos sueños por realizar.   Así fue que aprovechando su gusto por la culinaria, decidió implementar su negocio inicialmente en la puerta de su casa y cuando fue creciendo se trasladó a un lugar cercano, pero de mayor circulación y mas adecuado para la venta de productos alimenticios. Su meta es lograr la educación superior de sus hijos, que hoy se encuentran en las edades de 8, 10 y 14 años y con los que sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas. Su mayor deseo es mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales, pero ella sabe que paso a paso logrará ofrecerle a sus hijos mas bienestar mediante su trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina calentadora un freidor de mayor tamaño, con lo cual planea impactar a su clientela y aumentar sus ventas, con la imagen de calidad que con ello proyectará, porque su negocio así lo amerita.
texts.en: Jaquelin, 45, lives in the southwestern part of the city where she runs a fried food stall, selling cheese snacks, meat-stuffed potatoes, vegetables, chicken, tortillas and fried "patacones".  She has been in business for ten years and started with $50,000 COP in order to cover family expenses and carry out the many dreams she had.  Taking advantage of the fact that she likes to cook, she decided to set up business at home and then moved to a nearby location which was more appropriate for food sales when the business grew.  Her goal is to provide her children, ages 8, 10, and 14,  with a good education and see them become successful people.  Her greatest desire is to improve her living conditions, knowing that step by step she will able to give her children a better lifestyle through her work.  Currently, she is requesting a CrediKiva loan, which is her first through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy a hot food display case and a larger deep-fryer which she will use to attract customers and increase sales by projecting the quality image her business deserves.

loans.use: To buy a hot food display case and a larger deep-fryer.
